loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan works running a food stall. She used her previous loan to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family.

Lan is requesting a another loan to buy many kinds of food to sell to her customers. She hopes that her loan will assist her to increase her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. Lan also hopes that her loan will improve her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting another loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting another loan to buy materials for producing slipper molds. Hong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy metal materials for making slipper molds.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc is requesting another loan to buy a greater variety of products, specifically foods and household items, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, specifically foods and household items.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is requesting a new loan to buy quality food for her food stall so that she can serve a good quality for her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase good quality food

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc works running a general store. She used her previous loan to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Cuc is requesting a new loan to buy many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that her loan will assist her to increase her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. Cuc also hopes that her loan will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Al-Hasna Group

texts.en:
Al-Hasna group consists of six women from Taiz, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 175,000 YER from AMB.

Mriam is the leader of the group. She is 30 years old and single, living with her relative in Taiz. She did not complete her education and studied till the elementary school. All the family live in a poor area and It is very difficult and uncomfortable for them. 

Mriam accumulated a small amount of money to sell potatoes, fruit and other food items, getting a low income.  She would like to expand her business but she doesn't have the money to buy potatoes and fruit and another food items. Therefore, she asked for a 30,000 YER loan to buy potatoes, fruit and other food items to expand her business. In future, she hopes to improve her living conditions and open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and fruit and other food items to expand her business.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en: Greta is 56 years old and lives with her unemployed husband in the village of Ddmashen in the region of Gegharkunik. Their two sons are married and live separately with their families. Greta doesn't have a higher education and both her husband and she have been engaged in farming and agriculture for many years. They have a piece of land where they cultivate potatoes. They also have three cows, two calves, five sheep, two piglets and eleven chickens on their farm. Greta is requesting a loan for the first time. She needs 520,000 Armenian drams to buy animal fodder and seeds of potato. She really hopes that this deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon will bring a better income to her family and in future she can again cooperate with Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy animal fodder and seeds of potato

loans.name: Hayko

texts.en: Hayko is 52 years old and lives in Gavar with his wife and school-aged son. It is already seven years since he and his wife, who is unemployed, began farming. Their farm is very scant, since they have only two cows, three sheep, one piglet and ten chickens. They want to expand their farm and in this way to improve their poor living conditions. Hayko needs a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams to buy two more cows. He hopes to receive a a good income for his family as a result of this loan. On this occasion he is really relying on the kindness of Kiva lenders and hopes to cooperate with them again.

loans.use: To buy two more cows in order to expand his cattle breeding

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is requesting a new loan to buy materials for producing shoe molds. Van's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials for making shoe molds

loans.name: Ratna Shova

texts.en:
Ratna Shova is 47 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 29 and 25.  In 2000, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  

In the future, Ratna Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's 'kurta surwal' and men's 'daura surwal'.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth, materials or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is a 36-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Geghamavan in the region of Gegharkunik. He lives with his wife, two children (daughter and son) and his retired mother. 

For many years Hamlet worked in the contractual military service, but for ten years now, Hamlet has been engaged in farming and agriculture. Hamlet’s wife doesn't work and helps him around the farm. They have a not small private piece of land, where they cultivate potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. They also have a lot of animals in their farm: six cows, three calves, one bull, one piglet, eight sheep and twenty chickens. Hamlet’s wife is a very kind lady and all the work she does in their farm, she does with care and love. 

Hamlet is asking for a loan of 450.000 Armenian drams to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for his vegetable garden. Hamlet hopes for the support of Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for his vegetable garden

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is a 56-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one daughter. She and her husband have earned a living selling noodles for 25 years. Lang would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity of ingredients and good quality food to stock her food stall and serve good meals to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of ingredients and good quality food to stock her food stall and serve good meals to her customers

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a very nice young lady who manages farming and agriculture all alone. She is 25 years old, and with her two little children she lives in the village of Tsovagyugh in the region Gegharkunik. Like many other men in their village, Gayane’s husband also had to go to the Russian Federation in an effort to find work abroad in order to lighten and support Gayane with their family care. 

Gayane graduated from Sevan Medical College and she has the qualification of nurse, but she has never worked. Farming is the main source of money for the family. They have a perfect vegetable plot and a colorful fruit garden. Gayane also manages the care of their abundance of farm animals, consisting of three cows, one bull, two calves, one young piglet and twenty-two chickens.

She is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy fodder for the farm animals and also vegetable and fruit seedlings. It is the first time that she has dealt with Kiva and she hopes that it will be continued.

loans.use: To buy fodder for farm animals and also vegetable and fruit seedlings.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong, a 57-year-old married man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife run a business that sells and processes motorbike spare parts to people in their local community.

Cuong requests a loan to purchase more motorbike spare parts. That will enable him to offer a better range of products and services to his customers. He hopes his business will run smoothly and he can earn additional income to reinvest in his shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh, 44, is married and has three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income by producing plastic materials. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a large quantity of raw resin to stock for producing plastic materials so she can attract more customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of raw resin to stock for producing plastic materials so she can attract more customers

loans.name: Dúo Cristo Vive Group

texts.es:
DÚO CRISTO VIVE
El grupo está conformado por la señora María Consuelo tiene 43 años de edad el negocio que tiene es una tienda de productos comestibles de consumo diarios (pastas, jabón, etc.) desde hace 8 años tiene su negocio y  necesita otro crédito para poder surtir de mas marcaderia en la compra  de maíz y frijol  y algunos productos  de consumo diario el deseo de ella es seguir creciendo con su negocio  para  sacar adelante  a sus  3 hijos, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: One of the two members of the Cristo Vive group is 43-year old María Consuelo. She has run a store selling groceries such as pasta, soap etc. for eight years. Now she needs another loan to buy more stock for her store such as corn, beans, and other daily necessities. Marīa’s greatest wish is to continue growing her store so that she can help her three children get ahead. She hopes that the loan she is seeking will be forthcoming.

loans.use: buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene  is a 51-year-old man from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Eugene started selling lights in February 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will improve his adobe brick home where he lives with his wife and his grandchildren.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 37, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a mechanic. Lan has been running a general store that sells food and household items to people in her community for 7 years. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of new products such as food and beverages to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of new products such as food and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
This is Dila, dressed as always in her northern traditional wear. You will find the majority of women past their 40’s dressed this way in the rural north. Dila is in her early sixties and married with grownup children. Before arriving at her current location, she had resided in the very deep rural area of Albania. 

“I have been taking care of dairy animals for a very long time, let’s say forever. I sell fresh milk and make cheese and yogurt at home, but all I sell is milk and cheese because everyone in Albania makes their own yogurt at home,” she said.

“I want to expand the stable you see here and this loan will help me achieve this,“ Dila said, showing the building in the background of the picture.

loans.use: To expand the animal stable.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 35-year-old married man and a father of one child. He lives with his family in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a worker who gets a small salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs, but at the same time he is trying to offer better living conditions to his family.

He is requesting a 100,000 YER loan from AMB to cover the cost of purchasing a fridge and a washing machine for his house. Taking this loan will offer him and his family comfort so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a fridge and a washing machine for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn seeds to plant and pesticides for the veggies.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel highly appreciates the assistance given to him by Kiva that enabled him to purchase his first consignment of 100 LED lights.

He is now seeking a top-up loan of  30,000 RWF (Rwandan francs) to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights to sell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will improve his adobe brick home where he lives with his wife, Beltirde, and his two children (Pacific and David).

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soap, batteries, biscuits, chewing gum, etc., in bulk to add to his business.

loans.name: Enjellushe

texts.en:
Engjellushe wants to repair the damaged tractor that her husband uses for their field and also uses to help others in the village. This loan will help her achieve their goal.

She is fifty and has two children in their twenties. They live in southeastern Albania and three years ago she started investing time and money in agriculture.
 
“So far, it hasn’t disappointed me,” she said, smiling. “I have a dairy cow as well, but this fulfills only the family needs with dairy, that’s all. I want to add some more dairy animals to sell their products and generate some income. This is my plan for the future,” Engjellushe continued.

loans.use: To repair the damaged tractor.

loans.name: Ruseli

texts.es: Ruseli, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer amable y muy responsable, está casada con Alfredo y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 18 y 9 años de edad respectivamente, tiene su casa propia la cual pudo comprar junto a su esposo.El trabajo de Ruseli consiste en la venta de productos comestibles al por menor, es decir compra los productos en grandes cantidades y de ahí se encarga de venderlos al menudeo. Tiene una pequeña tienda instalada en un espacio de su casa la misma que pudo construir gracias al apoyo de su esposo. Entre los productos que ofrece tiene arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite, enlatados, bebidas gaseosas, condimentos y otros. Este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años, gracias a esta actividad pudo educar a sus hijos e implementar su casa con algunos artefactos. Complementa esta labor brindando servicio de peluquería en ciertas ocasiones ya que aún no tiene todos sus implementos de trabajo.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para realizar múltiples actividades dentro de su casa y le está yendo muy bien ya que siempre tiene clientes que atender, sus ganancias son considerables y eso le permite realizar la compra de sus productos de manera continua.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes como arroz, pan, azúcar, huevos, verduras entre otros, además comprará pintura para rediseñar su tienda.
texts.en:
42-year old Ruseli is a friendly, very responsible woman. She is married to Alfredo and has three children aged 22, 18, and 9. She has her own house which she and her husband were able to buy. Ruseli earns her living selling groceries which she buys in bulk and then sells in small quantities. The small store is located in her house and was built with help from her husband. She sells rice, sugar, eggs, oil, canned goods, soft drinks, condiments etc. It’s a job Ruseli has had for five years, and with the income she has been able to educate her children and buy some goods for her home. As well as running the store, Ruseli sometimes offers her services as a hairdresser although she does not yet have all the tools of the trade. She enjoys her job as she has time to do various other activities in the house. All is going well since she always has customers to serve, and her income is good allowing her to buy products on a continuous basis. 

Now Ruseli is seeking a loan of S/. 2000, an opportunity for which she is very grateful as it allows her to put into place her business plan. With the money she plans to buy a larger quantity of groceries such as rice, bread, sugar, eggs, and vegetables. She will also buy paint to decorate her store.

loans.use: buy products such as rice, bread, sugar etc.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Teresa, madre trabajadora busca como salir adelante con su familia, hoy en día tiene  su pareja que la acompaña y le ayuda en todo, sus hijos son ya mayores de edad e independientes, ella continúa con su pequeño negocio de ventas variadas como gaseosas, refrescos, ropa cosméticos entre otros, está muy contenta por haber invertido sus créditos en mejoras de su casa, pero aun le falta mejoras las condiciones del servicio sanitario por lo que con este nuevo crédito lo usara para instalar inodoro y mejorar las condiciones,  para tener un poco mas de comodidad con la familia.
texts.en:
Teresa, a hardworking mother, is trying to get ahead with her family.  Currently she has her partner who shares and helps her with everything.  Her children are already adults and independent.

She continues with her small business selling a variety of products such as soda, refreshments, clothing, cosmetics, and other things.

She'll use this new loan to install a toilet and improve her conditions so she has a little more comfort with her family.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, accessories, cement, cinder blocks, and rebar

loans.name: Besniko

texts.en:
A loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) will help Besniko buy some parts for his damaged tractor. Besniko is a 33-year-old married father of three children, all under the age of five. They live in rural central Albania where he practices his skills in plowing the land or turning the soil after harvesting with the tractor you see in the picture. 

He gets paid for this service and the money he gets in return is not bad, according to him. He lived and worked in Greece for a long time and now he is back investing time and money in his little business that he hopes will turn out to be profitable in some ways, despite the difficulties at first. He has already established a clientele and he is already happy about it.

loans.use: To buy parts to repair his tractor

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Verishen village, where she lives with her husband and daughter. Their family has been running a farm for 5 years. They keep 8 cows and 5 oxen and cultivate potatoes and cucumbers. 

Anna runs the farm with great love and care, and her husband sells the gathered harvest locally. The farming business is the only source of the family's income, so Anna and her husband would like to expand it.

Anna has applied to SEF International for this loan to purchase 3 cows and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is important for Anna and her family to enlarge their farm and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. To support her family, Trinh earns an income by running a business of making and selling clothing. She started this business 10 years ago. 

Trinh would like to take a loan to expand her current business. With the loan, she will buy a greater variety and quantity of fabric and sewing materials to make clothes to sell. 

Trinh hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of fabric and sewing materials to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 46, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

Anh started this business 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of food and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of food and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Tamba Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Tamba Joseph's Group consists of secondary school teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan from SMT for 4,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayments on their behalf.

Tamba is the leader of this group. A native of Niagbwema, Tamba is 54 years old, married, and has seven children, four of whom attend primary and secondary schools. Tamba has been a teacher for 34 years. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, cements, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, cements, etc. for the construction of a house

loans.name: Al-Amany Group

texts.en:
Al-Amany group consists of five female ladies from Sana`a, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 240,000 YER from AMB.

Amany is a 31-year-old married woman and she has four children. They all live in Sana`a. She had some training courses in sewing, and now she has the ability and skills needed to start up her business as a dressmaker. She works hard to provide for her family. She needs now to buy all sewing requirements, like a sewing machine, and so on. 

Therefore she requested a loan of 50,000 YER to help her buy these materials. She wishes to open a saving account in AMB when she makes a good profit and becomes a well-known dressmaker in the future.

loans.use: to buy all sewing requirements, like a sewing machine and so on, for her business.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Here is Naomi, a small-scale businesswoman in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Naomi sells market food – onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, etc. She has been doing business for many years now. With a loan of 4,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) she will buy onions, margi seasoning, tomatoes, etc., in bulk to add to her business.
 
Naomi is married. Her husband is a trader, too; three of her children are attending primary schools, and the other is in secondary school. Out of the daily profits she makes, Naomi is able to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy onions, margi seasoning, tomatoes, etc., in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Fatmata, a small-scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 5,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) in order to invest in her business. 

Fatmata sells building materials, chairs, etc. She has been in business for 31 years now in the city of Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. Fatmata is a wife and a mother of four children; three of her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Fatmata has requested this loan in order to add more inventory into her business. She will use this loan to buy building materials and chairs in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, corrugated zinc, chairs, etc., to add to her business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene 59 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 32 años se dedica la agricultura; antes cultivaba algodón, estas actividades se las enseño su padre desde que era muy pequeño. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, se reúnen varios vecinos, para compartir los gastos de trasporte ya que pagan un vehiculo particular para que les realice el viaje que son 43 kilómetros. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pesticidas, herbicidas, semilla, abono y pago de mano de obra para cultivar maíz, fríjol y maicillo. Con a inversión cultivara a tiempo, ya que el invierno esta muy cerca y si siembra en este momento su cosecha será buena. Su sueño, es continua trabajando muy fuerte, para brindar a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir y brindar a sus hijo educación para que sena unos profesionales. Además, desea sembrar otros cultivos como, plátano, sandia.
texts.en:
Leonardo, 59, is married and has three children.  He has made a living in agriculture for 32 years.  Previously he grew cotton.  His father taught him these activities when he was very young.

Several neighbors get together to buy the agricultural inputs, sharing the transportation costs because they pay a private vehicle to make the 43-kilometer trip for them.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy pesticide, herbicide, seed, and soil amendments, and to pay for labor to grow corn, beans, and sorghum.  With the investment he'll grow his crops on time, because winter is coming and his harvest will be good if he plants now.

His dream is to continue working very hard to give his family everything they need to live and to give his children an education so they'll be good professionals.  He also wants to grow other crops such as bananas and watermelon.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, herbicide, seed, and soil amendments, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Dúo Bellos Amaneceres Group

texts.es:
DUO BELLOS AMANECERES
El grupo lo forma doña Mayra Adelina,de 24 años de edad y es madre soltera, y se dedica a la venta de ropa típica como actividad principal y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años, vende tortillas a medio día y en la noche, con sus ganancias ella mantiene a su hija que tiene 4 años, solicita esta ayuda porque necesita comprar un poco de ropa típica de diferentes estilos y colores ya que para el día de la madre hay muchas personas que compran para regalar, y la otra parte para comprar maíz por quintal y así obtener un poco mas de ganancias espera que fape y kiva puedan apoyarla para ella superarse.
texts.en:
One of the two members of the Bellos Amaneceres group is 24-year old Mayra Adelina, a single mother whose main job is selling traditional clothing. She’s also been making and selling tortillas for the last three years, selling them in the afternoons and evenings. With the money she earns Mayra Adelina supports her 4-year old daughter.

She is now seeking a loan because she needs to buy more traditional clothing in different styles and colours ready for Mother’s Day when many people buy presents. With the rest of the money she plans to buy 100 kg of corn so she can earn a little more money. Mayra Adelina hopes that FAPE and Kiva will be able to help her get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy traditional clothing and 100 kg of corn

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Memuna, a small-scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 5,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) in order to invest in her business. 

Memuna sells ready-to-wear clothes, gara cloth (locally dyed cloth), Bamako cloth (ones dyed in Mali), portmanteaux, etc. She has been doing business for 20 years now. 

She is a wife and a mother of three children. Her husband is a trader, too, and two of her children are attending primary and secondary school. 

Memuna has requested this loan in order to buy ready-to-wear clothes, gara cloth, Bamako cloth, portmanteaux, etc., to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes, gara cloth (locally dyed cloth), Bamako cloth (cloth dyed in Mali), portmanteaux, etc., to add to her business.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is married with two children. Despite her young age (24 years old), Armine has been involved in agriculture for many years. She runs a farm which currently includes livestock (cows, pigs, sheep, chickens, turkeys and 5 colonies of bees). She also cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes.

 It is very difficult for Armine to take care of her two little kids and at the same time help her husband with the farming business. But, realizing that agricultural income is very important for their family, Armine and her husband do their best to get income and sustain their young family.

Armine has applied for this loan for the expansion of her farm. With the loan's help she will purchase seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock,  and also cover fuel costs. The loan is important for Armine to gather more agricultural income and ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock, and also cover fuel costs.

loans.name: Aghabek

texts.en:
Aghabek and his family are still engaged in farming. This is third loan from Kiva for Aghabek. 

Thanks to his previous Kiva loans, Aghabek enlarged his animal-breeding business. He breeds cows, sheep, horses and chickens on his farm. His wife helps him in this occupation very well, and they both are working hard day and night in order to sustain their family. 

As Aghabek confessed, he is a pensioner and couldn't find a job, and he is very happy that with the profit from his farming, he is able to meet his family needs and help his children, who are married and live with their families separately from their parents.
 
As the number of Aghabek’s animals has enlarged, he needs to buy a lot of fodder for them and transport it to his farm by his own vehicle, which he has bought with his last Kiva loan. For this, Aghabek asks from Kiva a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams.

loans.use: To buy a lot of fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is a young and hardworking farmer from the Syunik region. This region is famous for its severe climate, and locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding and some in limited land cultivation. 

Hayk keeps 100 sheep and cultivates potatoes. He sells his agricultural products locally and works hard to sustain his family of 5: Hayk himself, his wife, his sister and his parents. As the only breadwinner in the family, Haik does his best to breed the sheep and get income. 

He has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer, which is very important for the land cultivation, seeds and to cover fuel costs. This is very important for Hayk to be able to cultivate more fruits and vegetables and increase his income.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds, and to cover fuel costs.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit continues to operate her fruits and vegetables business in Yerevan. She rents a new shop in a more comfortable and populous area in Yerevan. Anahit’s son Rafael helps her with her shop. 

Ahahit is requesting her third loan from Nor Horizon, which she will use to repair her shop's roof and to buy fruits and vegetables from wholesale rural markets. Her previous loans helped her to expand her business and allowed her to move her shop to the central part of Yerevan, which is more comfortable and populous. In her new shop, Anahit has a many clients who prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from her shop because of her polite and professional service.

loans.use: to repair her new shop's roof and to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell in her shop

loans.name: Rufino Alfredo

texts.es:
Rufino tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Vive junto a su familia en un terreno que alquila a un familiar. Él toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, fue su padre quien le enseño a sembrar maíz, fríjol y maicillo.  Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a 9 kilómetros de su casa, a veces paga un vehiculo particular junto con otros agricultores para compartir los gastos de transporte. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pesticidas, herbicidas, semilla, abono, limpiar y rastrear el terreno para cultivar maíz y fríjol.  De esta manera dispondrá del dinero para comprar todos los insumos que necesita el momento apropiado para cultivar y obtener una muy buena producción. Su deseo es poseer más terreno para cultivar más, ya que la producción le sirve para consumo de su familia y también para la venta. De esa venta recibe los ingresos para mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rufino, 53, is married and has three children.  He lives with his family on a plot of land he rents from a family member.

He has worked in agriculture his whole life.  It was his father who taught him to grow corn, beans, and sorghum.  He gets his agricultural inputs in a city nine kilometers from his house.  Sometimes he and other farmers share the transportation expenses for a private vehicle.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy pesticide, herbicide, seed, and soil amendments to weed and break up the land for planting corn and beans.  This way he'll have the money to buy all the inputs he needs at the right moment for planting and getting a very good crop.

He wants to have more land to grow more, because his crop is for family consumption and also for sale.  From that sale he earns the income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, herbicide, seed, and soil amendments

loans.name: Al-Majd Group

texts.en:
Al-Majd is a group which consists of four ladies who live together in Hadramout, Yemen. They are hardworking women and applied for a loan of 240,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.
 
Phalestein is a 25-year-old married woman with one child. She is the leader of the group. She is illiterate and works hard to bring up her child. She started selling clothes door-to-door. 

She feels tired when she does the laundry by hand because she doesn’t have enough money to buy a washing machine; therefore, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She hopes to improve her living conditions and to send her child to school to become educated and have better future than her own.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, tiene la edad de 57 años y actualmente vive con madre. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos y plaguicidas para mejorar su siembra de maíz y frijol. El cuenta con una gran siembra de maíz y frijol de la cual espera obtener el máximo de las ganancias para salir adelante como persona. El espera con estas mejoras que su cultivo aumenta cosecha para la venta y así mejorar su estabilidad económica  y la de su madre. El tiene como meta salir con los pagos de su préstamo y tener un futuro más estable.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mario, 57, currently lives with his mother.  With the loan he plans to buy inputs such as soil amendments and pesticide to improve his corn and bean crop.

He has a large corn and bean field from which he hopes to get the maximum profits to get ahead as a person.  He hopes with these improvements to increase his harvest for sale and improve his economic stability and his mother's.

His goal is to make his loan payments and have a more stable future.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He had not previously had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to take care of his corn and bean fields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay college fees to pursue further studies

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Rana is a 29-year-old married woman with one son. Her husband is a worker who earns a small salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.

Rana wants to support her husband in completing their new house, so she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting the house and installing tiles. This loan will enable Rana and her husband to create suitable home conditions and enjoy living in their new house.

loans.use: To paint the house and install tiles

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Ibtesam is a 45-year-old married woman with four sons and three daughters. Her husband is a painter who gets a salary which is hardly enough to cover all costs.

Ibtesam wants to offer to her family suitable home conditions by completing the family's new house. She is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of installing tiles, new windows and doors in her new house. This loan will offer to Ibtesam and her family suitable home conditions so they can enjoy living in their new house.

loans.use: To install tiles, windows and doors in the new house

loans.name: Fardos

texts.en:
Fardos is 40 years old. She is a teacher, and she lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is hardworking and determined and does not fear challenges. However, the salary that she earns is not enough to cover her expenses. She likes her job because she develops and educates many students to achieve their goals.

She lives with her parents and relatives in a poor area in a small house. She would like to complete building a house, but she suffers the lack of money. She applied for a loan of 400,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy construction supplies to use for a house. She hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for a house.

loans.name: Al-Asala Group

texts.en:
Al-Asala is a group of three women living in Sana`a, Yemen. They were granted a loan of 210,000 YER (Yemen rials) by AMB. They aim to improve their businesses by using this loan.

Habiba is a 44-year-old married woman and has children; the oldest one is 25 and the youngest is 12 years old. She started a small business of selling food and soft drinks many years ago. She finds it difficult to accumulate a large amount of money to buy goods because most of the profit she makes goes to her family and children's expenses like school fees and clothes and food. Therefore, she decided to apply for a loan of 70,000 YER to expand her business and include different and new kinds of foods and soft drinks. 

She looks forward to opening a small grocery store in the near future instead of selling in the street because that would attract more customers, which in turn, would result in improving her income and helping the family go over the poverty line.

loans.use: to expand her business and include different and new kinds of foods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Saja

texts.en:
Saja is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the picture taken in their new house in her Kiva profile photo.

Saja is a 21-year-old young married woman with one son and one daughter. Saja is a housewife and her husband is a worker who earns a small salary, which is hardly enough to cover all costs.

Saja wants to support her husband in improving their family's living conditions by speeding up the process of finishing their new house, so she is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing and installing new tiles in their new house. Taking this loan will allow Saja and her family to move to into their new house soon and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To install new tiles in the new house

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Maria, de 46 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, vive en Managua es dueña de una pequeña tienda de mercadería variada donde vende cosméticos, ropa, bisuterías y productos comestibles su negocio lo inicio hace 8 años cuando vendía CDs poco a poco fue ahorrando para lograr poner su mini tienda de mercadería ella vende al contado y al crédito sale a vender fuera con clientes fijos que tiene desde que empezó su primer negocio. Ahora que la temporada del día de la madre está cerca y las ventas son muy buenas desea comprar ropa para damas, vasos, platos, abanicos pequeños, perfumes , ropa de cama. Uno de sus planes es agregar la venta de granos básicos ya que son productos de consumo familiar que le han solicitado sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, 46, lives in Managua and is the mother of four children.

She owns a small store where she sells a variety of merchandise: cosmetics, clothing, costume jewelry, and food products.  She started her business eight years ago when she sold CDs.  Little by little she saved and managed to set up her mini-store.  She sells on cash and credit, going out to sell to steady customers she has had since she started her first business.

Now that the Mother's Day season is approaching and sales are very good, she wants to buy women's clothing, glasses, plates, small fans, perfume, and bedding.

One of her plans is to add basic grains, family consumption products that her customers have requested.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, glasses, plates, small fans, perfume, and bedding

loans.name: Dúo Celeste Group

texts.es: Duo Celeste este grupo esta integrado por la señora Ludy Leticia, de 37 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos uno aun estudia,ella se dedica a la venta de utensilios de cocina, trajes para niños y sandalias ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace dos años, y ahora desea surtir con suéteres para damas. el sueño de ella es ayudar económicamente a su familia e hijos para que sigan estudiando, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de sueteres en diferentes diseños y para la compra de utencilios para cosina.
texts.en: One of the members of this group is Ludy Leticia.  She is 37 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is still in school.  Her business is selling kitchen utensils, children's outfits and sandals.  She has been in this business for two years and would now like to expand her range by purchasing some ladies' sweaters.  Her dream is to help her family out financially so that her children can continue studying.  She is requesting this loan to buy different designs of sweaters and some kitchen utensils.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Waldemar

texts.es: Waldemar, de 38 años de edad,esta casado con Nori y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 6 y 4 años de edad respectivamente,juntos viven cómodamente en su casa propia.Waldemar se dedica a dar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un mototaxi y empezó a cumplir este trabajo hace 12 años cuando se compró su primer vehículo pero ya con el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando su vehiculo.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos familiares. Se inició por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico, ya que no podía conseguir un empleo adecuado, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar sus horarios, además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra o sufre algunos daños de manera continúa pues le ocasiona muchos gastos que si no los soluciona a tiempo no puede trabajar con tranquilidad, pero aun así logra ver buenos resultados, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su actividad de transporte comprándose un vehículo de carga pesada ya que el pago en este tipo de transporte de mayor.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el apoyo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado pondrá en mantenimiento su mototaxi comprando algunos repuestos y accesorios que necesita para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Waldemar is 38 years old, married to Nori, and has three children who are 8, 6 and 4 years old.  They live comfortably together in their own home.

Waldemar's business is providing a passenger transport service with a motorcycle taxi.  He started out in this line of work 12 years ago when he bought his first vehicle.  Over time, he has replaced his vehicle.  He enjoys his business because it allows him to make income with which to cover his family's expenses.  He started out in this business because he needed to make income as he wasn't able to get a decent job.  He now feels more secure as he is able to set his own work hours and be his own boss.  On the other hand, he says he doesn't like it when his motorcycle taxi breaks down or continually needs repairs because it costs him a lot of money.  If he does not deal with these issues on time, he is not able to work peacefully.  However, in spite of this, he is doing well and has plans to grow his transport business by purchasing a heavy goods vehicle as he will be able to make a lot more money with that type of vehicle.  

On this occasion, Waldemar is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles.  He is grateful to all the people who will give him the support he needs to accomplish his goals.  Waldemar will use the sum he has requested to have his motorcycle taxi serviced, buying some spare parts and accessories that he needs in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Dúo Calvario Comalapense Group

texts.es: Dúo Calvario Comalapense, este grupo esta formado por la señora Maria elena, de 44 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de consumo diario, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 13 años poco a poco a ido creciendo su negocio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en productos comestibles para la venta ya que le hace falta capital para surtir un poco mas su negocio espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: This group, Dúo Calvario Comalapense, was formed by Maria Elena. Maria Elena is a 44-year-old woman who sells groceries for everyday consumption. She has been doing this for 13 years, and little by little, her business has grown. Maria Elena is applying for this loan to buy more groceries to sell. She needs the money to stock her business a little more. Maria Elena hopes that you can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Bineta réside au Sénégal. C’est une femme mariée  qui exerce l’activité de commerce pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle pratique depuis plus de 10 ans  la vente de crèmes glacées, de jus et de glace. Elle a déjà remboursé 06 crédits au sein du guichet   de  l’U-IMCEC où elle est membre. De nouveau, elle sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 150.000 francs CFA qu’elle veut employer pour réparer l’un de ses congélateurs qu’elle utilise pour son commerce de jus, de glace et de cremes glacées. Elle espère accroitre ses bénéfices  pour mieux faire face à ses charges familiales et  aussi rendre meilleur les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Elle souhaite  élever son taux d’épargne. Son projet futur est d’acquérir d’autres réfrigérateurs afin d’augmenter son offre de produits et développer davantage son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bineta lives in Senegal. She's a married woman who runs a business in order to provide for her family. For more than ten years, she's been selling ice cream, juices, and ice.

She already repaid six loans to the local branch of Kiva's partner, U-IMCEC, of which she's a member. She's seeking a new loan of XOF 150'000, that she wants to use to fix one of the freezers she uses for her business.

She hopes to increase her profits in order to better tackle her family's expenses, and also improve her family's nutritional conditions. She wants to increase her level of savings.

Her future project is to acquire additional refrigerators in order to bolster her product offering and expand her business.

loans.use: to fix her broken-down freezer

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in their house.

Dalia is a 25-year-old married young woman with three sons and one daughter. Dalia is a housewife and her husband is a worker inside the border who gets a low salary, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.

Dalia has requested a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her to cover the cost of installing new doors in her house. This loan will leave a positive impact on the lives of Dalia and her family and ensure them better home conditions.

loans.use: To install new doors in their house

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Safaa is a 30-year-old married young woman with two sons and one daughter. Safaa is a housewife and her husband is a worker with a low wage.

Safaa is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer to Safaa and her family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To buy new living room furniture

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children.To earn enough for their living expenses, she engages in the cooking and selling of meals and snacks in their community. Aside from her desire to finance the daily needs of her family, she also wants to support the educational needs of her children. With that goal, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP10,000 to add more dishes for sale to her menu. If the loan is granted, she intends to buy fresh meat, vegetables, fish, dressed chicken, eggs and other ingredients necessary for her business. With a positive mindset, Evangeline believes that through this loan, her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, vegetables, fish, dressed chicken, eggs and other ingredients needed

loans.name: Lesbia Patricia

texts.es: Lesbia Patricia de 29 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos estudiantes, su esposo es piloto de buses de una sola ruta, doña Lesbia se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace 3 años, ella inicio tomando la medicina por una enfermedad propia y dio resultado desde ese entonces vende y le ha ido muy bien pues sus ventas han incrementado, también vende cosméticos como cremas, champo,  delineadores, labiales, lociones, esta feliz porque a logrado aportar a su familia económicamente y ayudado a su esposo con el estudio de sus hijos, espera seguir creciendo como comerciante y seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que sean profesionales esta solicitando este credito para la compra de medicina naturl y cosmeticos para la venta.
texts.en: 29-year-old Lesbia Patricia is married and has two children who are both in school.  Her husband is a bus driver.  Lesbia has been selling natural medicines for three years.  She started her business after taking this kind of medicine for an illness she had herself and seeing that it worked.  Since then she has been selling these products and things have gone very well as her sales have increased.  She also sells cosmetics such as creams, shampoo, eyeliners, lipsticks, lotions, etc.  She is happy because she has been able to support her family financially and is able to help her husband with the cost of their children's education.  She hopes to continue growing as a saleswoman and hopes to continue helping her children so that they can become professionals.  She is requesting this loan to buy natural medicines and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Vernie

texts.en:
Vernie is a 31 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He earns 3,500 PHP a month from his gardening business. 

In 2012, Vernie became a member of GDMPC and is now requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. In the future, he plans to expand his garden.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: According to Mary, having six children is not easy.  So she and her husband work really hard to finance their needs. Given that scenario, Mary decided to open a sari-sari store (variety store). Unfortunately, this business is not doing quite well, so she wants to take out a loan of PHP 20,000 as additional capital for her business. If the loan is granted, she plans to use it to buy canned goods, rice, feed, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, beverages and seasonings. Through patience and hard work, she is hoping that her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, rice, feed, soft drinks, snack foods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell.

location.town: Brgy. San Pablo, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en: Mrs. Tserendolgor, 50 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband built their own house on a plot of land. Her daughter lives separately from her parents, on her own. She has been working as an attendant at a private business entity since 2011. Her husband renders transportation service between Ulaanbaatar and other cities. The house they live in is vulnerable to heat loss and to strong storms, due to a deteriorated and weak curb roof. So she is applying for a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to buy planks, fiberglass and cement. Using these materials, her husband can repair the curb roof of the house, thus stopping the loss of heat through the roof. Stopping heat loss will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and thus contribute to the efforts to combat air pollution. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy planks, cement and fiberglass to repair their roof.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a 59-year-old mother who owns and manages a small variety store in her village. She has been in business for almost four years. She and her husband aim for a successful life, in order to give their children a better future. For this reason, Angelina plans to improve her variety store and generate more income. Due to financial constraints, she is applying for additional funds in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy more stocks of canned goods, feed, rice, soft drinks, bread, noodles, school supplies and beverages. She hopes that her loan request will be approved, so she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, feed, rice, soft drinks, bread, noodles, school supplies and beverages to sell in her small variety store.

location.town: Brgy. San Pablo, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn's main source of income is selling fish. She has been in the business for already 13 years. With this activity, she usually generates PHP 3,000 a week, which has provided very essential support for the daily needs of her family. At this moment, Jocelyn needs additional capital to continue to run her business. To make this happen, Jocelyn is applying for a loan of PHP 20,000. She intends to use this amount to buy milkfish ("bangus ") and other kinds of fish to sell in the market. She is hoping that her loan application will be granted, so she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy milkfish ("bangus ") and other kinds of fish to sell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Due to financial constraints, Karen didn’t finish her college studies. Instead of going to school, she worked and helped her parents finance their necessities and supported the education of her younger siblings.

At present, she runs a small variety store in her village to generate income. She has been operating the business for almost five years, and usually earns a profit of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. She aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand, but does not have enough capital. Because of this, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock of rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell. 

Karen is very optimistic that the loan she is requesting will be of great help in the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Bundan

texts.en: Mr. Bundan, 64 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He was working at a military base until his retirement. Now he has the position of field utilization engineer at a building company. His wife has retired and receives a state pension. His son works as a general engineer at another building company. His work time is short, so he decided to grow vegetables as a food source and for sale. So he is applying for a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy necessary items, such as a shovel, pipe for watering, and seeds. Those materials are needed urgently, because the appropriate season for growing vegetables is here, and any delay will result in a poor harvest. Growing vegetables will contribute to the efforts against air pollution, because vegetables convert carbon dioxide into oxygen though a process called photosynthesis. The borrower is a disciplined and hard-working individual who wants to improve his life.

loans.use: to buy a shovel, pipe, and seeds to start growing vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Octavio

texts.es: José, es un humilde pero trabajador comerciante que vende ropa y zapatos desde hace 10 años, casado, padre de 2 hijos gemelos de 15 años de edad. Inicio con ayuda de financiamiento de otras instituciones, poco a poco fue ahorrando para comprar más mercadería y vender su esposa y el salen a vender a los departamento y cuando sus hijos están de vacaciones también lo apoyan en el negocio. Juntos trabajan por salir y conseguir una mejor calidad de vida ya que el deseo de don José es lograr que sus hijos tengan una carrera universitaria. Hoy requiere el crédito para comprar zapatos, sandalias, chinelas y ropa. Esto le permitirá aprovechar la temporada del día de las madres y conseguir buenos ingresos para su negocio. Pues desea ofrecer variedad en su mercadería con precios accesibles que sus clientes se sientan a gusto con su servicio.
texts.en:
José is a humble but hard-working salesman who has been selling clothing and shoes for 10 years.  He is married and the father of fifteen-year-old twins.  José started his business with financial help from other institutions and gradually saved up enough to buy more merchandise so that his wife could sell too.  The couple travel to different regions to sell their products and when their children are on holiday from school they also support their parents in the business.  José and his wife work so that they can make progress and enjoy a better quality of life.  His wish is for his children to go to university.

José needs this loan to buy shoes, sandals, flip flops and clothing.  This will allow him to make the most of the time of year when people are buying gifts for Mothers Day and he will make good income.  José likes to offer his customers a good range of merchandise and affordable prices so that they are happy with his service.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, flip flops and clothing

loans.name: Fatou Diop

texts.fr: Mme Fatou est une femme marié qui habite au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle est spécialisée dans  la vente de produits cosmétiques et d’habits de friperie. Cette activité lui  lui procure des bénéfices  lui permettant de prendre soins de ses enfants. Membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle a déjà  obtenu 03 prêts antérieurs, elle sollicite a nouveau  un montant de 100.000 francs CFA qui sera destiné a l’achat des  produits qu’elle commercialise. Elle souhaite en effet  renforcer son fonds de roulement et développer son activité de commerce. L’augmentation des  profits qu’elle gagne  lui donnerait l’opportunité d’épargner plus d’argent pour renforcer progressivement son fond de roulement. Son futur projet est d’ouvrir un magasin où elle pourra exposer les produits de son commerce.
texts.en:
Fatou is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been an active merchant for the past five years. Fatou specializes in the sale of cosmetics and used clothing. This business allows her to earn enough money so that she can take care of her children.

Fatou is a member at one of the branches of UIMCEC and has obtained three prior loans. She is currently seeking a new loan of 100,000 francs CFA that she will use to purchase her retail products. Fatou wants to build her working capital and expand her merchant activity.

The increase in her income would allow Fatou the opportunity to save more money and progressively increase her working capital. Fatou's next project is to open a store where she can display her retail goods.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products and used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a Kubo Financiero client. This is her story.

My name is Laura I own and work in a beauty salon.  I started the salon 21 years ago with my sister in my mother's house,  then my sister got married and moved,  I kept the business and have been working on my own for the last 13 years.  I am a 40 years old, single and live in my parents house, I finished elementary school and then started working.

My slogan is: "beauty comes first". My strength is on cutting hair, hair removal and tint bases. I will use the loan to buy some furniture, improve the image of the beauty salon and get more clients.

loans.use: To buy furniture and refurbished her beauty salon.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es: Desde hace 6 años confecciona ropa en general y uniformes principalmente, en un pequeño taller ubicado en su propia casa ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 8 y 14 años. Su negocio es parte de la tradición de su familia, pues su madre también se dedicó a ella, de quien aprendió viéndola desde su infancia y hoy en día se apoyan, pues entre las dos confeccionan uniformes escolares y deportivos y además comercializan productos mediante guías especializadas de negocios, que también les representa un ingreso. Sus tareas diarias inician desde las 7 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde sin cesar, así realiza las operaciones de compra de materias primas e insumos, diseño, corte, reparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas, para finalmente comercializarlas. Sus compras las realiza de contado y sus ventas  a crédito y algunas de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como telas, hilos, y accesorios, porque requiere hacer una producción de  sabanas, resultado de su preventa, su meta mas adelante es comprar una bordadora y tener su propia vivienda y su mayor desafío es lograr que sus hijos se conviertan en   profesionales exitosos y tengan un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
For six years, Catherine has been sewing clothing in general, but mainly uniforms, in her small sewing workshop which is located in her own home, in the south of the city of Barranquilla.  She lives with her husband and their two children who are 8 and 14 years old.  Catherine's business is a kind of family tradition as her mother is in the same line of work.  It was from her mother that she learned her skills, watching her since she was a little girl.  Now mother and daughter support each other as they both sew school uniforms and sports kits.  In addition, they also sell products through specialized company catalogs which makes them extra income.  Their daily tasks begin at 7.00am and they work, without stopping, until 6.00pm.  They buy raw materials and supplies, design, cut, repair, sew, finish off the garments, then sell them.  They make their purchases with cash and their sales are on credit though some are for cash.  

Catherine is currently applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) to buy raw materials and supplies such as fabric, threads and accessories because she has an order for some sheets that she needs to fill.  Her goal for the future is to buy an embroidery machine and to own her own home.  Her biggest challenge is ensuring that her children become successful professionals and have a promising future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies such as fabric, threads and accessories

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: Katherine, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer alegre, luchadora y emprendedora. Es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Katherine es la venta de madera aserrada como listones, tablillas y otros para paredes y pisos. Toda esta madera la compra en los aserraderos y las vende en el mismo lugar o en su casa donde tiene un espacio acondicionado para cumplir esta labor aunque por lo general consigue vender todo en el mismo lugar, atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes por lo que ha logrado ganarse la preferencia de cada uno de ellos y gracias a eso es muy recomendada. Se inició hace 3 años con un capital propio, vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades, luego fue aumentando sus ventas gracias a la demanda de este producto. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y gracias a la buena acogida.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su acceso al préstamo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos laborales.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de maderas como listones, tablillas , entre otros y al por mayor para que continué trabajando.
texts.en:
Twenty-three year old Katherine is a bright, determined and enterprising woman. She is unmarried and lives with her parents and siblings in their own house. Katherine works selling timber: slats, boards and other pieces for walls and floors. She purchases all of the wood from sawmills and sells it from the same place. She also sells from home where she has an area equipped for this purpose. However, she is usually able to sell everything at the sawmill. She tends to her customers in a friendly way, and this has earned her the preference of each and everyone one of them. Thanks to this, they recommend her to others.

She began this business 3 years ago with her own capital. She sold in small quantities and soon increased her sales due to a high demand for the product.  She considers her business to be quite profitable due to the income that it generates for her and also because of the good reception it has received. 

On this occasion she requests 2000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles. She thanks all of the people who make it possible for her to access to the loan. She needs the loan to reach her work objectives. She will use it to purchase wood wholesale so that she can continue working. This includes slats, boards, and other pieces.

loans.use: to purchase wood wholesale.

loans.name: Altanzagas

texts.en:
Altanzagas, 36, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has a daughter who lives with her grandparents. Altanzagas and her husband reside in their own house on a plot of land. 

She has been purchasing and selling furniture to local people at a trade center for two years. First she posts advertisements about purchasing old furniture and after people call her, she visits their home and values their furniture and purchases it. Later she sells the old furniture at a higher price along with new furniture imported from China. Before the furniture business, she sold automobile spare parts. 

The house they live in has been renovated recently but curb roof repair and interior decorations remain to be completed, so she is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to purchase building materials such as gypsum, paints, and wallpapers. Using those materials, she can finish her house renovation completely. The renovated house will certainly improve their living conditions greatly. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is from the village of Centro 2, Angadanan. She is 58 years old, married, and has five children. To support her family, Evelyn is engaged in the retail business. She has been in this kind of business for 30 years. Evelyn usually sells vegetables, hats, slippers, and groceries. She has a net income of PHP1,500 a week. At this time Evelyn needs additional capital to continue to run her retailing business, so she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy vegetables, slippers, and groceries to sell. Evelyn hopes to grow her business as well as her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, slippers, and groceries to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 36 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Elma has been farming rice for 6 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 41 years old and married with two children.

Emerita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, soft drinks, etc..

Emerita has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and raising pigs.

Emerita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Florina

texts.en: Florina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years. She is requesting a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business. In the future, Florina would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Cicil

texts.en: Cicil is a 21-year-old single mother living in Taraka, Jimenez on the island of Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. To earn a living, she is working in a company and earning 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month but this is not enough to support the daily needs of her and her child. Thus, she has become a member of GDMPC and is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase goods such as beauty products to sell in the local community. In the future, Cicil wants to send her child to school.

loans.use: To buy goods such as beauty products to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 28 years old and single with two children living in Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operate a sari sari (convenience) store, selling grocery products in the local community and earning 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) monthly. 

This year, after joining GDMPC, she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and other inventory capital. In the near future, she dreams to have better living conditions and a complete family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and other inventory capital.

loans.name: Elman Santiago

texts.es: El señor Elman habita en el municipio de Masaya junto a su esposa e hijos, los dos han luchado mucho para poder establecerse como pareja y darle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de Vida, el es agricultor, cosecha yuca y en la actualidas necesita establecer y darle mantenimiento a una manzana de siembros, con este credito comprara los insumos y fertilizantes necesarios para que su cosecha mejores y pueda asi obtener buenos resultados al momento de sacar su producto a la venta, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado estos años.
texts.en:
Elman lives in the town of Masaya with his wife and children. The two have struggled a lot to be able to establish themselves as a couple and give a better condition of life to their children. He is a farmer. He harvests yucca and currently needs to establish and maintain 7000 square meters of cultivated land.

With this loan he will buy the supplies and fertilizers necessary for better harvests and to therefore be able to obtain good results at the time when he takes his product to sell. He is thankful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva Funds have provided him these years.

loans.use: to maintain crops.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 41 years old, married with 8 children, seven of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Imelda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business.

Imelda has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is a 44 year old married woman with five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income.

Andresa is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and fuel for the fishing boat. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch and have more fish to sell in the market. Andresa dreams of improving their business so that it will augment their income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, de 47 años de edad , es una mujer buena y amable, es madre de tres hijos de 24, 21 y 16 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia .El trabajo de Lina consiste en diseñar y crear prendas de vestir, del mismo modo arregla aquellas prendas que sus clientes le entregan con alguna imperfección hasta dejarlas en perfecto estado. Tiene su pequeño taller en su hogar y lleva realizando este trabajo por 18 años, esto le permitió alimentar a su familia por mucho tiempo y gracias a ello sus hijos pudieron recibir una buena educación. Trabaja sola y está muy contenta ya que le esta yendo bien aunque en ciertas temporadas la clientela disminuye.Cuando se inició con el trabajo de costura tenía dificultades por la falta de experiencia tales como la imprecisión en el corte de las telas o para elegir la tela adecuada para cada tipo de prenda, sin embargo ha aprendido a superar estos contratiempos gracias al paso de los años y a las capacitaciones que ella misma buscaba para mejorar su trabajo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000 soles y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales para seguir realizando su trabajo, entre ellos comprará elásticos, telas, botones, aplicaciones, encajes, hilos de colores y otros.
texts.en:
47-year-old Lina is a kind, friendly woman.  She is the mother of three children, who are 24, 21 and 16 years old, and her children live with her in her own home.  Lina's business is designing and making clothing.  She also repairs clothing that her customers bring to her, restoring them to a perfect condition. Lina has a small workshop in her home and she has been doing this work for 18 years.  It has allowed her to feed her family and provide her children with a good education.  Lina works alone and is very happy because her business is going well even though her number of customers decreases at certain times of year.

When she started sewing for a living, Lina experienced a number of problems stemming from a lack of experience such as inaccurately cutting her fabric or not picking the right fabric for each garment.
