This group comprises three entreprising and successful members. One of them is Aydalina, who is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has two children. She is originally from Masaya. She has been making and selling fried pastries and meringue cookies for fifteen years as a street vendor in the capital. She has been a client of our institution for ten months. She will invest this loan in purchasing ingredients and supplies like flour, sugar, firewood, plastic bags of different sizes, cinnamon, eggs, food coloring, etc.

Lizett is 26 years old and her business is selling sandals, while Rosa is 69 years old and her business is selling tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies, like flour, sugar, firewood, plastic bags of different sizes, cinnamon, eggs, food coloring, etc.

loans.name: Hilario De Jesus

texts.es: Hilario de 38 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos,  se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz, maicillo y frijol. Hilario desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso ha solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Hilario, 38, is a man who is very responsible with his commitments at home.  He currently lives with his wife and three children.  He works growing corn, sorghum and beans.  Hilario wants to increase sales which is why he’s asked for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy seeds and manure, among other things to continue bringing daily bread home.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra maíz y frijol cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos a las agencias de compra-venta de granos basicos. José desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
José’s a man who takes his home commitments seriously since he’s always been noted for providing the best for his family.  He currently lives with his wife and son.  He’s very hardworking and always works with joy and enthusiasm.  He works growing corn and beans and when the harvest is ready he stores it in silos like shown in the photograph to then go out to sell it to agencies that buy and sell basic grains.

José would like to increase his sales which is why he’s requested a loan to buy seed, manure, fertilizer and pesticide, among others.  He’d like to get the requested help because he has no other source of income and this way he will be able to continue providing daily bread for his home with no limits whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional fruit to sell for her business.

Rosa has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from farming rice, pig fattening and from her general store.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene,  a 31-year-old married woman with four children, comes from Pana-on, Misamis Occidental and is earning 4,000 PHP monthly from her 'sari-sari' store business, selling dry goods in their local community. She's been doing this business for three years to help her husband. In 2012, she joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance and now, she's requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She wants to have  better living conditions for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socios emprendedores una de ellas es Claudia mujer de 50 años, casada, con un hijo su negocio es la venta de fritangas y almuerzos en el mercado de Masaya, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 12 años, 4 años de estar trabajando la institución  como clientes, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como 30lbs de carne de pollo, 20 lbs de carne de res, 20 lbs de frijoles crudos, 15º plátanos verdes, 150 plátanos maduros, 3galones de aceite, 1 galón de salsa de tomate, 1 galón de vinagre, 5 unidades de repollo, 1 galón de mostaza, 5lbs de cebolla,etc. Merali, tiene 34 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de fritanga en su domicilio, Erick tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de productos lácteos y brinda servicio de moto taxis, Claudia tiene 45 años su negocio es la venta de muebles y cerámicas.
texts.en:
This group consists of four enterprising members. One of them is Claudia, a 50-year-old woman who is married and has one child. Her business involves selling fried foods and breakfasts at a market in Masaya. She has been in business for 12 years and has worked with ADIM as a client for four of those years. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as 30 pounds of chicken, 20 pounds of beef, 20 pounds of raw beans, 150 green plantains, 150 ripe plantains, 3 gallons of oil, 1 gallon of tomato sauce, 1 gallon of vinegar, 5 units of cabbages, 1 gallon of mustard, 5 pounds of onions, and other items.

The other members are as follows: • Merali is 34 years old and has a business of selling fried foods from her home. • Erick is 31 years old and has a business of selling dairy products. He also provides motorcycle taxi services. • Claudia is 45 years old and has a business of selling furniture and ceramics.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, raw beans, green plantains, ripe plantains, oil, tomato sauce, vinegar, cabbages, mustard, onions, and other supplies.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a Lebanese single man. He is 30 years old. He is living with his parents and two working siblings. His father seeks to manage the family’s life and cover their expenses. This is the reason why Imad started to work really hard to take some responsibilities off his father.

 Five years ago, Imad started his independent business. He opened a coffee shop in his town. He has his own loyal customers who always meet at his place to have fun and enjoy their free time. With his requested youth loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l he will be able to renovate his coffee shop. This will increase the number of his customers and most probably his revenue. One of his greatest dreams is to save money and have his own family and children.

loans.use: to renovate his coffee shop

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and married, with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Teresita has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and other farm equipment

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Violeta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits like jackfruit, grapes, bananas, and other fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits like jackfruit, grapes, bananas, and other fruits to sell

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат добрая женщина и имеет высшее образование. Ей 56 лет. Она вдова и имеет 2 сыновей. Сыновьям 27 и 36 лет. Адолат очень заботливая мать для своих сыновей. Она всегда старалась, чтобы ее дети были счастливы. Адолат более 15 лет работает в средней школе учительницей информатики. Еще она выполняет должность заместителя директора по хозяйственным делам. Адолат любит свою профессию и честно выполняет все свои должности. Она имеет хорошую репутацию среди коллег, и она считает, что «учитель-главное звено общества».  Адолат тратит свою зарплату для обеспечения семьи. Уже несколько лет она планирует отремонтировать свою квартиру, но не имеет денег. Она должна отремонтировать все комнаты и покрыть крышу шифером, так как во время дождевого сезона, дождь течет с потолка. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для ремонта квартиры. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Adolat is a kind 56-year-old woman, who possesses a university degree. She is a widow and caring mother of two sons, who are 27 and 36 years old. Adolat has always tried to ensure her children's happiness. 

Adolat has worked as an informatics teacher in a high school for more than 15 years. She is also the vice-director of agricultural matters. Adolat loves her profession and believes that teachers are the bond that holds society together. She spends her salary to take care of her family. 

Adolat has been planning to renovate her apartment for a few years now, but she doesn't have the money. She needs to renovate all the rooms and cover the roof with slate because it leaks during the rainy season. She is requesting a 10000 som loan to renovate her apartment. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for repairing her apartment

loans.name: Amparo Justina

texts.es: Doña Amparo, una señora que ha procreado 8 hijos, lo cual no ha sido nada fácil darles la alimentación, educación y muchas otras  cosas primordiales en la vida, pero como es trabajadora y con la ayuda de su esposo ha logrado salir adelante, hoy en día casi todos son independientes a excepción de dos que todavía son adolecentes y están a su cargo, su medio de ganarse la vida continua siendo una pequeña pulpería, ella busca como mejorar las condiciones de su hogar por lo que solicita este 4to crédito para reparar techo y continuar la construcción de un cuarto que ya había empezado y espera con este financiamiento poder avanzar lo más que pueda ya que le hacen falta paredes ventanas entre otros.
texts.en:
Amparo is a woman who has had eight children.  Giving them food, an education, and a lots of other life essentials has not been easy at all.  However, as a hard-worker, and with help from her husband, she has managed to get ahead.  Now almost all of them are independent.  Only two are still adolescents and under her care.  Her way of earning a living continues to be a small grocery store.

She is looking for a way to improve her homes conditions.  That is why she is requesting her fourth loan to repair the roof and continue building a room she has already started.  With this loan she hopes to be able to advance as much as she can.  The room needs walls and windows, among other things.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es de la comarca Escobillo Teustepe casado, tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya están casados. Él se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol y cuenta que aunque el papa en aquel tiempo que él era joven tenía dinero el no pudo aprender a leer ya que el papa solo vivía tomando licor y al morir el papa quedo en la ruina, su hermano mayor le enseño a trabajar la tierra sembrando maíz y frijol , a la edad de 25 años se casó y la mama le heredo partes de las tierras y ganado que hasta hoy conserva , sus labores de siembra las con ayuda de mozos a los que les paga  por día trabajado y cuando saca la cosecha la lleva a vender al mercado de Managua ya que alla le pagan muy bien el grano además don francisco vende sus cuajaditas de la leche que le proporcionan sus vacas.  Hoy don francisco está solicitando este crédito para comprar fertilizantes, el abono y pago de mano de obra para hacer la huerta de maíz y frijol .Don francisco dice que el crédito le ayudara a realizar todos los trabajos de la siembra de maíz y frijol , él dice que una vez que cancele el crédito con los ingresos de la cosecha el dinero que le sobre piensa invertirlo en mejoras de la finca.
texts.en:
Francisco’s from the Escobillo District in Teustepe.  He’s married and has six children who are all married now.  

He works growing corn and beans and he relates that even though his father back then had money, he wasn’t able to learn to read because his father was an alcoholic and when his father died they were left bankrupt.  His older brother taught him to work the land and to grow corn and beans.  

He got married at the age of 25 and his mother passed down land and cattle to him that he still has today.  He does his farming chores with help from laborers he hires and pays a daily wage to.  When his harvests are in he takes them to be sold in the market in Managua because he’s paid well for the grains there.  Francisco also sells the cheese made from milk his cattle produces.

Today, Francisco is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay labor costs for his corn and bean crops.  Francisco says that the loan will help him do all the work required to plant corn and beans.  He says that once he repays the loan with income from the harvest he will use any left over money to make improvements to the farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Sammary

texts.en:
Sammary lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has one child and has been doing her farming work for five years.  Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: Tea picking. Her biggest challenges are unpredictable climate and crop diseases.

Sammary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "It has a grace period."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "They are good for our development."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, How will this loan benefit her family, Sammary replied, "It will help generate income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Sammary owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net, running water, but does not have electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Socorro Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatros socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosaura, mujer de 37 años, casada, y con dos hijos menores, desde hace 8 años su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos nuevos, tiene un año de ser cliente de la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, blusas, faldas, talladoras, camisas para hombre, sandalias, zapatos de damas etc. Janeth es una mujer de 31 años su negocio es la venta de artículos plásticos y Catalina tiene 47 años de edad y su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas como naranjas dulces, tamarindo etc. y Myriam tiene 47 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de hojas de chagüites para hacer nacatamales al por mayor.
texts.en:
This group is composed of four enterprising members.  One of them is Rosaura, 37, who is married and has two minor children.  Her business for the last 8 years has been selling new clothes and shoes.  She’s been a client of the institution for a year.  She will use the loan to buy clothes like men’s pants, women’s pants, blouses, skirts, corsets, men’s shirts, sandals, women’s shoes, etc.

Janeth, 31, sells plastic ware and Catalina, 47, buys and sells fruit harvests like orange and tamarind and Myriam, 47, sells banana leaves at wholesale to make Nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales].

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto, solicita un nuevo préstamo para mantenerse activo trabajando y así obtener ingresos para los gastos familiares; este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas y semilla de maíz.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Humberto is requesting a new loan so that he can remain active in his work and generate income for family expenses. This loan will enable him to buy farming supplies such as herbicides, insecticides, fungicides, pesticides, and corn seeds.

His previous loan helped to improve his financial condition. His family circumstances have also become optimal.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, insecticides, fungicides, pesticides, and corn seeds.

loans.name: Juan Irene

texts.es: Juan, es una humilde habitante de Boaco, viudo, padre de 4 hijos , se dedica a la venta de leche y costura . Su primer negocio fue la costura tomo un curso de 5 meses después fue aprendiz de un sastre que le enseño desde planchar hasta coser cada centímetro de tela, le fue gustando él tenía 25 años cuando aprendió este oficio adicional vende leche en su humilde carretilla y sus recipientes de plásticos llenos de leche y listo para abastecer a su clientela, es así como se gana la vida a diario buscando cada día conseguir una mejor calidad de vida. Hoy está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar tela y leche. Esto le permitirá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendiente y abastecer como cada mañana a sus clientes con leche fresca. Uno de sus proyectos próximos es mejorar su vivienda componer el techo antes que entre el invierno.
texts.en:
Juan is a humble resident of Boaco. He is a widower and a father of four children. He works selling milk and sewing. His first business was sewing. He took a five month course and later apprenticed under a tailor, who taught him everything from ironing to sewing every inch of fabric. He took a liking to this trade, which he learned when he was 25 years old. Additionally, he sells milk from his humble cart in plastic containers filled with milk and ready to supply his customers. That is how he earns his daily living, finding his way day by day to achieve a better quality of life. 

Today he is requesting financing in order to purchase fabric and milk. This will allow him to fulfill his pending orders and supply his customers with fresh milk every morning. One of his next projects is improving his home by repairing the roof before the winter comes.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and milk.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en la agricultura;  este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas.
 El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos, las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Marvin is requesting a new loan because he needs more working capital in order to continue investing in agriculture.  This will allow him to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides.

The previous loan helped him increase his income.  His financial condition and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel has sold over 300 water filters, providing clean drinking water to over 1,500 people. Rachel sells the Nazava Water Filters through a network of sub-resellers in remote places of Indonesia, like Manado in North Sulawesi and Timor in East Indonesia.

Rachel wants to use this loan to expand sales on the island of Timor. As Indonesia has over 900 inhabited islands it can take very long to ship goods from the main island, where Nazava filters are made, to islands in eastern Indonesia. To get the filters quickly, Rachel always preferred to use airfreight, which of course is very expensive. Using the KIVA loan to finance a bigger stock of water filters, she can now choose for much cheaper sea freight. This will help Rachel to save around 5 USD per water filter.

“It is very hard to get clean drinking water in East Indonesia. Many people still boil their water on wood which is time consuming to collect or expensive to buy.  Besides, burning on wood emits greenhouse gases and the indoor fires cause many respiratory diseases. Nazava Water Filters make well and rain water safe to drink without the need for boiling," she explains.

With this loan Rachel will provide a convenient solution to obtain clean drinking water to more than 100 households faster and cheaper than ever before.

loans.use: To expand water filter sales and increase the access to safe and affordable drinking water in Kupang, East Indonesia Province

loans.name: Meteda

texts.en:
Mr. Meteda is a committed salesman who lives on the northern shore of Papua. Papua is one of the most remote islands of Indonesia and is the scene of a long lasting armed unrest.

Safe drinking water is hard to get in Papua, therefore Meteda is proudly selling Nazava water filters that turn well and rain water into water that is safe to drink. By selling Nazava Water Filters, Meteda earns an additional 100 dollars per month while at the same time providing clean drinking water to many of his community members. 

Most trade in Papua is done by migrants from other parts of Indonesia. Meteda, who is a native Papuan, sees it as his duty to show his fellow Papuans that they can also become successful businessmen.  Meteda can be found in local markets around his hometown, Sentani, promoting Nazava Water Filters.

Meteda wants to expand to more local markets, plus begin doing demonstrations at local offices. Meteda will use this loan to buy more Nazava water filters on credit. Because Meteda lives more than 3000 kilometres away from the Nazava warehouse it is very important to have enough stock.

loans.use: To grow his water filter business and be a role model for other local entrepreneurs

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi  Luz Group

texts.es: Tres socios emprendedores forman este grupo una de ellas es Angélica mujer de 22 años de edad, casada, con un hijo, tiene 9 años de tener una pulpería en su domicilio , de ser cliente de la  institución tiene 8 meses, ella misma atiende su negocio el crédito lo  invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, queso, productos lácteos, papel higiénicos, jugo de latas, jugo en cajas, sal, carne de res, carne de pollos, vegetales, bisuterías, pampers, productos lácteos, leñas, medicamentos populares, huevo, sopas maggi, etc. Miguel tiene 39 años de edad su negocio es la venta de verduras y perecederos y Milagro tiene 38 años de  edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Three enterprising members form this group.  Angélica, age 22, is one of them.  She is married and has one child.  She has had a grocery store in her home for nine years.  She has been a client of the institution for eight months.  She tends to her business herself.

She will use the loan to buy basic goods like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, cheese, dairy products, toilet paper, canned juice, juice boxes, salt, beef, chicken, vegetables, costume jewelry, Pampers, firewood, popular over the counter medications, eggs, and Maggi brand soups, etc.

Miguel, age 39, has a business selling vegetables and perishables.  Milagro, age 38, has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Chikim B Group

texts.en:
Chikim B Group consists of ten hard-working women. They live in a village which is about 40 km away from the town capital of Manipur which is in the North-Eastern state of India. The extreme left in the picture is Ngailam and she is featured with hand raised. She represents the featured borrower for the Chikim B Group and she runs a toy shop in the town market. She lives with her ailing husband and four kids. Her husband is suffering from a prolapsed disc thus he cannot move freely.

Ngailam sell toys in the town market shed and she makes a very good profit. Her sales includes toys for girls and boys whose age ranges from 3-13 yrs. She sells dolls, kitchen wares, dressing kits, doctors kits etc. for girls and plastic guns, pistols, water pistols, paint guns and GI Joes for boys. She makes a good income because there are very few vendors for toy shops. Kids like to purchase new toys and play with them thus it is essential for her to refill her shop with more interesting toys to attract kids. Her sales increase during the summer and winter breaks because kids are on vacation. Therefore, she keeps track of the school breaks and makes sure she has what the kids want in her toy shop.

With the Kiva Loan she will purchase more variations of toys for both boys and girls. She is planning to purchase and sell Barbie dolls, stuffed toys, war tanks, remote access toys and super heroes masks. She always wanted to keep these toys in her shop but her income was small. She also takes care of her ailing husband who needs a monthly routine check-up in which she spends a lot on medication. She is glad that Kiva will assist her financially in bringing growth to her business and allowing her to sell better and attractive toys.

Her plan is to save money and give surgery in a well-reputed private hospital in the state capital. She thanks WSDS and Kiva for the love and support towards herself and the Chikim B Group. The rest of the group members are also engaged in poultry, weaving, piggery, and grocery.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of plastic toys and expand the shop.

loans.name: Dinas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras con éxito una de ellas es Dina mujer de 35 años, soltera con dos hijas su negocio es la venta de zapatos y ropa nueva, tiene 4 años de estar en ese negocio, anteriormente era ama de casa, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de zapatos varonil, zapatos cerrados, zapatos bajos de dama, zapatos pumas, chores bandex, camisetas de cuello de varón, pantalón Texas de varón, blusas, camisolas etc. Esther tiene 30 años de edad y su negocio es un taller de zapatería y Patricia mujer de 28 años su negocio es la venta de zapatos.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 3 entrepreneurs who have been successful. One of them is Dina, a 35-year-old woman, who is single with 2 daughters. Her business is selling shoes and new clothes. The business has existed for 4 years. Previously, she was a housewife. 

The loan Dina is requesting will be used for buying mens shoes, closed-toed shoes, low-heeled womens shoes, Pumas, Bandex clothes, T-shirts with mens collars, Texas-style pants, blouses, camisoles, etc.

Esther is 30 years old and has a shoe-making shop.  Patricia is a 28-year-old woman whose business also sells shoes.

loans.use: to buy men's shoes, closed-toed shoes, women's low-heeled shoes, Pumas, Bandex clothes, T-shirts with mens collars,Texas-style mens pants, blouses, camisoles, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mimi Lom Group

texts.en:
Zamdeihching's husband usually teases her by saying, "You love weaving more than your husband" and she laughs it off. Her love for weaving is undeniable and proven. Her supportive husband is the main reason for her to do well in her business. He understands and initiates her weaving activity. She is the featured borrower for the "Mimi Lom" Group and she is pictured on the extreme left corner with raised hand. Their group is comprised of five women who live in a town which is about 60 km from the main capital town of Manipur, which is in the north-eastern side of India.

Zamdeihching is a very talented and fast learner when it comes to weaving. She used to be a paid weaver before she was married. After she was married, her husband bought a loom for her and she started weaving for her own income. Gradually, she started making a good progress and started supplying her woven products to the shops in town. Her hard work pays off with the trust she earns from her clients/customers. In order to meet the demand she bought two more looms on credit and also started hiring paid weavers. With the profits she could successfully pay back her loan for the loom and also pay the hired weavers. 

She says the demands are rising each day and she couldn't meet the demands of her clients with three looms and four weavers only. Therefore, with the Kiva loan, she will purchase one more loom. She is glad that she will be able to utilise her profits in buying different yarns and weaving materials while the Kiva loan will be used for purchasing a loom. She aspires to own a shop in the town market where she can sell her products. She says "Thank you so much for the support Kiva" and wishes a good luck.

loans.use: To purchase another loom and increase her woven products for more profits.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
Jairo,35 años de edad , es un humilde comerciante habitante de Boaco, casado, padre de tres hijos,  él  es dueño de una pequeña pulpería negocio que inicio desde hace 4 años empezó vendiendo dulces, pan ,azúcar y frijoles. Hoy en día vende jabones, papel higiénico, enlatados, gaseosas y jugos con el paso del tiempo poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio. Él tiene pensado poner un pequeño kiosco de snacks y jugos a orilla de la carretera por eso sigue ahorrando por lo pronto quiere comprar un freezer para vender pollo y carnes productos que aún no vende, es por esto que parte  de las ganancias las está ahorrando para ese proyecto.
Él está requiriendo  el crédito para comprar azúcar, aceite, avenas, galleta, pan, jugos, gaseosas, enlatados, detergentes, jabón, papel higiénico.
texts.en:
Jairo, age 35, is a humble merchant living in Boaco.  He is married and has three children.  He has a small grocery store business, which he started four years ago.  He started selling candy, bread, sugar and beans.  He now sells soaps, toilet paper, canned goods, soft drinks, and juices.  With the passage of time, little by little, he has been stocking his business.

He is planning on setting up a small snack and juice kiosk on the edge of the road.  Therefore, he will continue saving.  For the time being he wants to buy a freezer in order to sell chicken and meat products that he does not yet sell.  This project is what part of his savings is for.

He needs a loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, oatmeal, cookies, bread, juices, soft drinks, canned goods, detergents, soap, and toilet paper.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, oatmeal, cookies, bread, juices, soft drinks, canned goods, detergents, soap, and toilet paper.

loans.name: San Juan 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado (San Juan 2) está en su tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde algunas señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, con ingresos muy bajos. La encuesta les ayuda a conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eulalia, quien en su primera encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con un ingreso medio, pero aun poco, ella trabaja en la venta de bebidas y comestibles, y  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, capacitación e incentivo que le da la fundación ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Este Comité  esta con ganas de trabajar con la fundación es su tercer crédito a través de comité. Están conscientes que tienen que trabajar más y aplicar las capacitaciones que se le brinda constantemente 
La Sra. Eulalia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, para vender,  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group's name is San Juan 2. It is in its third cycle within the Women's Committee Program, where they all work and help each other in order to get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination survey, and some of the women are living below the poverty line, that is, with very low income. The survey helps them understand each of their situations. 

One of this group's members is Eulalia, who according to her first survey was at poverty level #2, that is, medium income but still low. She works selling drinks and food items, and she is improving her situation thanks to her own effort and persevering work, as well as through trainings and incentives offered by our foundation. This Committee is eager to keep working with our foundation and this is their third loan through the Committee. They are aware that thay have to work harder and consistently apply the trainings they attend.

Eulalia is requesting this loan to purchase meat to sell. It will help her define her business plan, which will in turn help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more eggs and her income helped their family household. The loan also helped in the education of her children. She has been in this business for three years and she continues to work to provide for their family.

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy additional eggs and salted eggs.  More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth dreams that her business will continue to grow and that she will have a stall in the market. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional eggs and salted eggs needed for her business.

loans.name: Hara Gouri Group

texts.en:
In 2010, six poor women from a slum area of Bhawanipatna Municipality located in Kalahandi district, one of the poorest regions in India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family by sharing the burden of the family with their husbands. 

All members hail from the Schedule caste and belong to the below poverty line category. The traditional work of this community is cobbler (making, repairing and polishing of different leather products). Normally this work is done by the male members. They formed a joint liability group named Hara Gouri. One of them is Surekha. The lady sitting second from the right with raised hand in the photo is Surekha. Surekha is 33 years old; living with her husband and three sons aged 16, 14 and 11. All three of the children are attending normal school. 

Surekha herself has been selling vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, onions, brinjal, ladies finger etc., and seasonal fruits like mangos in the daily market of the town for the last 15 years. She brings stock from the local wholesalers. There was always some left-over stock that was not sold which had to be thrown away as they did not have a storage space of their own. So, Surekha decided to start selling these vegetables on her own by the roadside in the market. She now wants to rent a shop that will help her to have a place to sell the vegetables. It will also help her to buy more stock for starting a wholesale business. Buying more stock will help reduce her frequent travel to the market and eventually transportation and buying costs. A portion of the loan amount will help her to rent a shop in the market and purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits. Surekha hopes to complete the construction of her half-built house as soon as possible.

The other five members of her group are Chanchala, Sabita, Kumudini, Gouri and Premsila doing same business of vegetable vending.

loans.use: To buy vegetable items like potato, tomato, brinjal etc.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 40 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Vivian is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Vivian has been raising livestock for 15 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Adiba

texts.ru: Адиба умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 21 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 дочь, которой 2 года и зовут ее Сарвиноз. Ее муж работает в ГЭС электриком. Она выросла в семье преподавателя, так как ее родители являются преподавателями в средней школе. Адиба после окончания средней школы, поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет по специальности юриста. Она является одной из активных студентов и учится отлично и хорошо. Она любит такие предметы, как история, права человека, политология и т.п. В свободное время она читает художественную литературу и смотрит интеллектуальные телепередачи. Она данное время является студенткой 2 курса и должна оплатить за учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Adiba is an intelligent and hardworking 21-year-old woman. She is married and raising her two-year-old daughter, Sarvinoz. Her husband works as an electrician in a hydroelectric plant. 

Adiba grew up in a family of teachers, as her parents are both high school teachers. After completing high school, Adiba was accepted to the law program at Tajikistan State University. She is one of the most active students and gets very good grades. She loves subjects like history, human rights, political science, etc. In her free time, she likes to read literature and watch intellectual television shows. 

She is in her second year of studies and it is time for her to pay her tuition. Hence, she is requesting a loan to cover her tuition costs. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a "buy and sell jewelries" business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional jewelry to sell for her business.

Zenaida has been in this business for 17 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional jewelry to sell

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010 five women from Bhawanipatna of Kalahandi district in Odisha, India formed a group named Maa Mangala to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business. Bimala is one of them. The lady standing on the extreme right with a yellow color sari in the photo raising her hand is Bimala. She is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two sons aged 23 & 20. Her two sons are helping Bimala in running the business.

Bimala has been running an electrical goods selling business for last 10 years. Her elder son supplements in her business. She sells electrical goods like bulbs, wire, tube lights, frames, holders etc. Bimala was able to increase the variety of items at her electrical shop with the previous two loans from Mahashakti Foundation and increase her cash flow. Her monthly income from the existing business is 6,000 Rupees. Out of this small income she is hardly managing her household expenses. 

As per the statement of Bimala she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop but not the inventory. She wants to increase stock of her business. This is the third loan for Bimala and from this loan amount she is planning to purchase electrical items like bulbs, tube lights, frames, holders, sockets etc. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock frequently. Bimala hopes to save enough for building a permanent house. The other four members of the group are Bijayalaxmi, Chandrakanti, Ratni and Malati who are running fast food center, tea and tiffin stall, tiffin hotel and betel shop respectively.

loans.use: To purchase electrical items like bulbs, tube lights, frames, holders, sockets etc.

loans.name: Shakr

texts.en:
Shakr, who appears in the photo, is a 31-year-old married man and a father to three children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better life.

He is employed and gets a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs. He feels embarrassed when guests come to his house due to lack of money to buy furniture.  

He is requesting a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB to help him cover the cost of purchasing furniture in order to improve the living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer Shakr and his family comfortable furniture so all of them can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing furniture

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a restaurant business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish another restaurant business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 100,000 she wants to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Norgul

texts.ru: Норгул женщина, которая имеет трудную судьбу. Ее любимый муж погиб, и она осталась без кормильца с 4 несовершеннолетними детьми. После смерти мужа ей было очень трудно справляться с расходами семьи. Она получала доход от выращивания сельхоз культуры. Полученный доход не хватал для обеспечения детей, и она очень расстраивалась. Норгул потом начала дополнительный бизнес, то есть купле продажей овощей и фруктов. Год за годом в экономике семьи наблюдается улучшение. Она хочет купить больше фруктов и овощей для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Norgul has had a tough lot in life. She beloved husband died, leaving her without a provider for her four children. It was very difficult for her to deal with finances after her husbands death. She received an income from the crops she grew, but this was not enough to support her family and she was very upset. Then, she started another business in fruit and vegetable trade. As years passed, her family's economic situation improved. She wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables to replenish her working capital. She is requesting a 1500 som loan. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to increase working capital

loans.name: Barsilisa

texts.en: Barsilisa is 50 years old.  She is married and has one child who is in school.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Barsilisa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Barsilisa has been farming sugarcane for two years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and fattening pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 49 years old and has six children. Catalina is married and has three children who are in school.  Catalina is raising pigs in the Philippines. Catalina requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Catalina has been pig fattening for 14 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en: Leilanie engages herself in buying and selling different kinds of fish in the village. She has been patiently doing this for the past three years. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy different fish varieties, such as tilapia, to sell.  This kind of fish is in demand, so she needs to purchase more of this. She hopes that her requested loan will be approved so that she can improve her selling business.

loans.use: to buy different fish varieties to sell, such as tilapia

loans.name: Ba

texts.en: Ba would like to take a further loan to buy beverages to sell from her stall. Ba's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Blas; está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están poniendo su pequeño grano de arena para ir creciendo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, donde casi todas las integrantes ya lograron superar la línea de pobreza; a través de las Capacitaciones del Plan de Negocios y Técnica en Ventas y la lucha de todas.
Una de las integrantes, Maria, cuenta que trabaja en las ventas, ya que tiene un pequeño copetín bien surtido donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Es una persona que lucha por crecer e ir mejorando su día a día y la de su familia. Su sueño es poder crecer con su negocio y seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Solicita este crédito para la compra de bebidas, gaseosas, jugos, empanadas, sándwich entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The San Blas group are participating in their 6th loan cycle within the Women's Committee program.  They are all doing their part so that they can continue growing as a group.  Each member is participating in the poverty elimination survey so that they are aware of everybody's situation.  Almost all of the members of this group are already living above the poverty line as a result of the business plan and sales techniques training sessions they have attended and the hard work they all do.

One of the members of this group, Maria, says that she is a saleswoman.  She has a small but well-stocked diner where she works every day, from very early in the morning.  She is a person who works hard so that she can grow and keep improving her own life as well as that of her family.  Her dream is to be able to grow her business and continue helping her loved ones.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy drinks, soda, juice, empanadas, sandwiches and other products.  This will help her to realize her business plan and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy drinks, soda, juice, empanadas, sandwiches, etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia vive en la ciudad de Itá junto con su esposo, tiene una familia conformada de tres hijas, en edades escolares.
Lidia tiene un taller de costura montado en su casa, ella retira trabajos de sus clientes que se encuentran en la zona del mercado, en el negocio les ayuda su marido y sus hijas. Cuenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de gallinas en el mercado y su marido trabajaba en una fábrica de, pero como el negocio de la costura les iba resultando de apoco, se dedicaron netamente a ella.
El crédito lo solicita para la inversión en su taller de costura, para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir creciendo y mejorando la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia lives in the city of Itá with her husband and three school-age daughters.

Lidia has a sewing workshop in her home.  She takes on jobs from her customers who are located in the market district.  Her husband and daughters help her in the business.  She says that she previously used to sell hens in the market and her husband worked in a factory but when the sewing business gradually took off they started working in it full time.

Lidia is requesting this loan to invest in her sewing workshop.  She will buy fabric, threads, buttons and other supplies so that she can continue growing and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, buttons and other supplies

loans.name: 24 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité “24 de mayo” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la Ciudad de Santaní, ellas son mujeres de campo, que apuestan todo para poder ayudar a sus familias, son jefas de familia que quieren salir adelante y crecer.
La mayoría de ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, ovejas y demás, y con ello lucha por salir adelante y sacar a su familia de la pobreza. Feliciana es una de las miembros de este grupo, ella también se dedica a la cría de animales, está solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y así seguir alimentando a sus animales y que no les falte nada. Ellas agradecen por la oportunidad que estan recibiendo, pues les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The 24 de Mayo communal bank was formed by the union of various neighbors in the city of Santani.  They are women of the field who go all out in order to be able to help their families.  They are the heads of their households, and they want to get ahead and grow.

Most of them raise and sell barnyard animals like chickens, pigs, sheep, and the rest.  With this they struggle to get ahead and to get their families out of poverty.

Feliciana is one of the members of this group.  She also raises animals.  She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy balanced feed for her animals.  This way she will continue feeding her animals, and they will not need anything.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting.  It will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru: Гулджахон является опытным бухгалтером и живет вместе семьей в старом доме. Ей 25 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она более 4 года работает в Государственной организации бухгалтером. Она всегда стремится к инновацию и планирует повысить свою квалификацию, то есть она планирует поступить ВУЗ в заочное отделение. Гулджахон получает маленькую зарплату и поэтому у нее нет денег для проведения ремонта. Она хочет отремонтировать все комнаты. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1400 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краска и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Glujakhon is an experienced bookkeeper who lives with her family in an old house. She 25, single, and lives with her parents. FOr more than 4 years she has been working as a bookkeeper in a government organization. She always strives be innovative, and is planning on raising her qualifications; that is, she is planning on taking some correspondence courses at a college. Glujakhon receives a small salary and does not have enough money to do repairs on her house. She wants to remodel all of the rooms. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1400 US dollars to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials as wood, cement, and paint for repairing her house

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 35 years old and married with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Analyn has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell to her customers.

Analyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña se encuentra en el 3º ciclo y está integrada por 14 señoras de la ciudad de San Pedro, una ciudad bastante alejada, donde la mayoría de las miembros son de comunidades de difícil acceso y con muchas dificultades.
Todas las integrantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría y venta de animales de corral. Ellas se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese esfuerzo. Maria, una de ellas, cría y faena animales, y solicita de este crédito para compra de mas animales para la cría y posterior faena para poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a los suyos.
texts.en:
The Kuña communal bank is in its third cycle.  It is comprised of 14 women from the city of San Pedro.  This city is pretty far away, and most of the members are from communities that are difficult to access and have many difficulties.

All of the members work in agriculture and raising and selling barnyard animals.  They put forth great effort to get ahead and to help their families through this effort.

Maria is one of them.  She raises and slaughters animals.  She is requesting this loan to buy more animals to raise and later slaughter.  She will do this to be able to continue growing and helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and slaughter.

loans.name: Hazam

texts.en: Hazam, a high school graduate, is 29 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. The owner of a bus/van, Hazam is a driver who works hard to provide for his family's daily expenses. He has applied for a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts to repair his bus. These repairs will improve his service and therefore his income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his bus.

loans.name: La Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza II está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, están empezando a trabajar juntas y se ayudan para que por medio de las capacitaciones vayan mejorando sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de las miembros.
Carla, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en su pequeño Kiosco, en donde trabaja para tener los ingresos necesarios para su familia. Es una persona muy luchadora, que conforme pasa el tiempo quiere ir mejorando su microemprendimiento.
La Sra. Carla solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, picadillo, azúcar, Harina, jabón, aceite, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener mejores productos y a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Esperanza II communal bank is in its first cycle with the Women’s Committee Program.  They are starting to work together and help each other.  They are doing this so that, through the trainings, they will be improving their income and the members’ quality of life.

Carla is one of the members.  She sells basic needs items at a small kiosk.  She works there in order to get the needed income for her family.  She is a very tenacious person.  As time goes by she wants to be improving her small business endeavor.

Carla is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, minced meat, sugar, flour, soap, and cooking oil, etc.  This will help her to have better products and to firm up her business plan.  This will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, minced meat, sugar, flour, soap, and cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 35 years old, married to Anastacia, and the father of two children, aged five and two years.

His wife works in their retail shop, while Mike still makes deliveries of milk and bread to his customers. He also offers transport with his motor bike. With this loan, he plans to add more milk from farmers for sale and buy a stock of wheat flour and tea leaves for the shop.

Mike hopes to expand his business and invest for his family.

loans.use: to buy more milk, wheat flour, and tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 55 years old and married. She has nine children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 34 years.

Lucila requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more fish to sell. Lucila would like to save money, for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes de este comité están esforzándose por mejorar lo que cada una está haciendo, y así brindar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para salir adelante, son mujeres jefas de familia que han decidido tomar en sus manos las riendas de la casa y luchar.
Una persona ejemplo es Fabiana, quien se dedica a la venta de tortas, cuenta que recibe bastantes pedidos de personas de todas partes, y que gracias a eso le está yendo muy bien. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y que lucha por salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de harina, huevo, azúcar, dulce, y demás insumos para poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las tortas deliciosas que hace.
texts.en:
The 13 members of this communal bank are putting forth great effort in order to improve what each one is doing.  This way they will provide their families with everything they need to get ahead.  They are women who are the head of their households, and they have decided to take the reins of their households in hand and to persevere.

Fabiana is an example.  She sells cakes.  She says that she gets plenty of orders from people from all over.  Thanks to this, it is going very well for her.  She is a very hard-working person, and she struggles to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar, sweets, and the other ingredients in order to be able to continue delighting her customers with the delicious cakes that she makes.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, sweets, and the other ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El señor  Justino tiene 48 años, está casado con la señora Anuncia quien tiene 50 años ambos oriundos de la ciudad de Caacupé, tienen 3 hijos, que ya son mayores e independientes a ellos, que han criado con mucho esfuerzo.
El señor Justino se dedica al forrado de termos en cuero y cuerinas, y cuenta que le está yendo muy bien, ya que la venta de termos de un tiempo para acá ha crecido mucho.
Solicita el crédito para comprar más materiales y preparar más termos de agua caliente para la temporada de invierno, ya que tiene mucho pedidos y quiere seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Justino, age 48, is married to Anuncia, age 50.  They are both from the city of Caacupé.  They have three children who are now adults and independent from their parents.  They raised them with great effort.

Justino has a business of thermoses covered in leather and imitation leather.  He says that it is going very well for him.  This is because thermos sales have grown a lot from some time ago up until now.

He is requesting the loan in order to buy more materials and to prepare more hot water thermoses for the winter season.  This is because he has a lot of orders, and he wants to continue working.

loans.use: to buy materials like thermoses, leather, imitation leather, and others for work.

loans.name: Review Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 46 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She operates a general store in Malindi town, having been in the business for the past four years. Florence earns a monthly profit of 12,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of 30,000 KES. Florence intends to use the loan to add stock, such as cooking oil, cooking flour, soft drinks and so on, to resell at her business. She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In the future, Florence hopes to grow her general store so as to better her family's financial condition.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is 37 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Glenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc.

Ma. Glenda has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and also earns income from retailing gasoline.

Ma. Glenda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc..

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

For the past twelve years, he has owned a cafe business; neighbors and town dwellers are his customers. He faces a major challenge of fluctuation in the number of clients, hence perishability of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, he wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat. 

He dreams of expanding his business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat for his café.

loans.name: Guidelyn

texts.en:
Guidelyn is 29 years old and married she has two children, both of whom are in school.  

Guidelyn is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Guidelyn has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Guidelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Ma. Welsita

texts.en:
Ma. Welsita is 58 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Welsita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Ma. Welsita has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the variety store for 20 years, and also earns income from selling seafood.

Ma. Welsita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, de 21 años es una señorita muy amable, buena y trabajadora, es soltera pero tiene un pequeño hijo de 2 años, vive a lado de su madre y su hermano en su casa propia. El trabajo de Graciela consiste en la compra y venta de madera, compra trozos de los diferentes lugares que están ubicados cerca de su vivienda y los lleva a procesar en su taller hasta obtener piezas simples ya sea en listones y tablas, de ahí coloca todo lo obtenido en su almacén en donde los vende de manera individual.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas.Con el monto solicitado comprará madera para empezar de nuevo con el proceso y convertirlos en listones y tablas.
texts.en:
Graciela, 21, is a very friendly, good, and hardworking young woman.  She's single but has a small two-year-old child.  She lives with her mother and her brother in her own house.

Graciela's job is buying and selling wood.  She buys pieces from different places near her house and takes them to her workshop to process them until she has simple pieces, whether in strips or boards.  Then she puts everything in her store where she sells them individually.

Currently she'll request 2500 soles [PEN].  She's grateful for this opportunity to get the loan she needs to continue achieving her goals.

With the requested amount she'll buy wood to start the process once again and convert it into strips and boards.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De La Asuncion Group

texts.es:
El grupo está en su  3 ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación económica de cada una de ellas, donde 7 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con un ingreso muy escaso.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.Miguela quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, pero pese a ello, se está esforzando por mejorar su economía y así poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella tiene una pequeña cantina con todo tipo de productos, y es gracias a esa variedad que tiene muchos clientes y está luchando por salir adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de golosinas, bebidas, comestibles y demás insumos para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes lo que le solicitan y también seguir invirtiendo en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
This group is in its third loan cycle of the women’s committee program. They are doing the poverty elimination survey to understand the economic situation of each member of the group. Seven members of the group are below the poverty line, which means that they have very low income.

One of the members of the group is Miguela, who in her last survey was at level one on the poverty scale. But despite this, she is working very hard to get ahead, to improve her economic situation, and to give her family what they need. She has a small snack bar from which she sells all types of products, and it is thanks to this variety of products that she has many customers.

Miguela is requesting this loan to buy candies, soft drinks, food items and other items to stock her snack bar. With this loan she will be able to continue offering her customers what they request, and she will be able to continue investing in her business plan.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks and food items for her snack bar.

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años de edad, esta casada y tiene cuatro  hijos. Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 38 años, siembran maíz, frijol maicillo y hortalizas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas: como abono, semillas y rastreo de la tierra para cultivar maíz, frijol y maicillo. Su objetivo es aplicar los insumos a tiempo para que su cosecha sea muy abundante; para que con esos ingresos pueda tener la oportunidad de cultivar mayor cantidad de granos básicos,  comprar un carro para trasladar los insumos y la cosecha y que sus hijos sean felices.
texts.en:
María, 52, is married and has four children.  She and her husband have earned a living in agriculture for 38 years.  They grow corn, beans, sorghum, and vegetables.

The loan she's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy agricultural inputs such as soil amendments and seed and to plow the land for growing corn, beans, and sorghum.

Her goals are to apply the inputs on time so the harvest will be very abundant, to have the opportunity with that income to grow a larger quantity of basic grains, to buy a car to transport the inputs and the harvest, and for her children to be happy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to plow the land for growing corn, beans, and sorghum

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell nuts business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of nuts to sell.

Johna has been in this business for three years; she earns additional income from a grinder.

Johna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of nuts to sell

loans.name: Felisa Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Felisa Esperanza de 36 años de edad  se dedica a la  crianza y venta de pollos y cerdos, en su domicilio cuenta con un espacio donde logra la crianza de pollos y cerdos los cuales para fechas  en las que son más buscadas como por ejemplo para la feria  patronal, o fiestas como bodas,  Además viaja dos  a tres veces por semana al mercado de la localidad de Pachalun a la venta de pollos en pie, ella logra vender un ciento de pollos cada viaje que hace al mercado de pachalun. con esto doña Felisa ha obtenido un ingreso con la que ella logra aportar para el sustento de su familia y el estudio de sus hijos y algunas mejoras que junto a su esposo han  hecho en su vivienda. Doña Felisa requiere de capital  para lograr comprar más cerdos de engorde como también  invertir en la compra de  pollos para solo realizar entrega en los mercados locales.
texts.en:
Felisa Esperanza, 36, makes a living raising and selling chickens and pigs.  At her home she has a space where she raises chickens and pigs for times when they're most wanted, such as the patron saint festival or weddings.

She also travels two or three times a week to the market in the town of Pachalun to sell live chickens.  She manages to sell a hundred chickens every trip she makes there.  With this Felisa has earned an income with which she's able to contribute to supporting her family, her children's studies, and some improvements that she and her husband have made to their home.

Felisa needs capital to be able to buy more pigs to fatten as well as chickens to sell in the local markets.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens to raise

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. Aileen is married and has a busiiness buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines.

Aileen requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional used clothes to sell. She has been in this business for five years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her used clothing business.

In the future, Aileen  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 60 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Laura runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc. Laura has been in this business for 21 years.

In the future Laura would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc

loans.name: Pazil

texts.en:
Pazil is 31 years old. He lives in a small village of Bolnisi District with his wife and parents. Pazil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where haricot is grown. They sell the harvested products locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Pazil requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Pazil will purchase calves. He plans to raise them and resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves; raise and resell them at a higher price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase water pipes.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is taking out another Kiva loan of Kes 50,000 to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and to Yehu micro-finance for the opportunity granted.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 50, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She has four loving children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Alicia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Alicia’s regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Alicia dreams of expanding her business. She meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kokoe James

texts.en:
Kokoe James is a 36-yr-old businessman who lives in Yei. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 3 and 9. All of them go to school. Kokoe runs a general store, and has been in business for 6 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers.

He is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase more maize flour, cooking oil, rice, etc. He has no other source of income in addition to this business.

In 5 years Kokoe would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs.

Kokoe James says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like maize flour, cooking oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad  de más capital de trabajo para generar mayores utilidades; este le permitirá comprar  variedad de pescado, asimismo verduras para elaboración de la sopa de puya tales como: zanahorias, tomates, güisquiles, pipián, chiles, entre otros, también medicamento para comercializarlo.
El crédito anterior  le ayudo a mantener la liquidez  del negocio y mayor desarrollo económico; las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y también las condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Rosa is asking for a new loan because she needs more working capital so she can buy a variety of fish and vegetables, including carrots, tomatoes, squashes, peppers, pipian, and other things to make puya soup.  She will also buy medications to sell.

The previous loan helped her maintain her business' liquidity and financial development.  Her family and financial circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy ingedients.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 51, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilou operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Marilou dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a simple life with her kids.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mildred works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from ice cream making, gasoline sales and raising chickens. 

Mildred is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like eggs, spices, coffee, sugar, cream, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.
