She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store, gasoline sales and raising chickens.

Mildred has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like eggs, spices, coffee, sugar, cream, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rafael Jose

texts.es: Rafael es un hombre de 34 años de edad, casado, empresario exitoso, tiene 10 años de tener su negocio en la elaboración y comercialización de muebles de madera, tiene 2 años de ser cliente de la institución, los muebles los vende en los diferentes mercados de la capital y en el mercado de Masaya, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como madera fina, respaldos decorados, pernos, lijadoras, lijas, selladores, base etc.
texts.en: Rafael is 34 years old, married, and is a successful entrepreneur.  For the past ten years he has been making and selling wooden furniture.  He's been with the institution for two years.  He sells his furniture in different markets in the capital and in Masaya.  He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as fine wood, decorative supports, bolts, sanders, sandpaper, primer, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Sabeeha

texts.en:
Sabeeha is a 40-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and 5 children. Her children are currently studying in schools and there are huge educational expenses for their studies.

Her husband is working in a welding shop. Sabeeha has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase a new welding machine and some welding material like rods and chemicals, etc. His income would be increased in this way and many of their financial problems would be solved. 

Sabeeha is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
This is Ma. Elma, 53, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joselito, a driver and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Ma. Elma operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php,50,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Elma dreams of having another branch and hopes to have another source of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 60 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase feeds and additional livestock to raise.

She has been raising livestock for 9 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Note: I will make correction for the borrower family name: previously Anlagada, now Onlagada as error during encoding.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has been operating a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors, pupils and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 50,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the opportunity given.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice for the business.

loans.name: Geiner Alexander

texts.es:
Geiner de 37 años de edad, se encuentra casado y es padre de dos hijos menores de edad, desde hace algún tiempo se dedicó a la elaboración de lápidas, pero el negocio no resultó rentable, por lo cual su condición económica se vio deteriorada, razón que lo ha impulsado a crear una legumbrería y venta de huevos desde su residencia, negocio al que le ve viabilidad debido a la carencia del mismo en el sector.
En la actualidad no cuenta con los recursos para dicha inversión, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de legumbre y huevos con el fin de dar inicio a su proyecto de negocio.
Espera que con el desarrollo de la actividad pueda mejorar su condición económica y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Geiner is 37 years old, married, and the father of two children who are minors. 

For a while he worked making gravestones, but the business did not turn out to be profitable, and as a result his financial situation deteriorated. This is the reason why he has been motivated to start selling vegetables and eggs from his home, a business he sees as viable because of the shortage of it in the area. 

Currently he doesn't have the resources for this investment, so he is applying for a loan to buy vegetables and eggs with the goal of starting up his business project. 

He hopes that with the development of the business he will be able to improve his financial situation and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and eggs

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 52 years old, married, and a mother of seven children. For the last ten years, she has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of about KES 9,000. 

Rebecca was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for her third loan of KES 35,000 to buy seeds, some fertilizer and other farm supplies needed for her business. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her young children as well as to expand her farming activities. Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase additional farm supplies needed for her farming activities.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family.  Rosalinda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 35 years now.

Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.  She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.  She 

In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Philister is 25 years old, married, and a mother of three children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling fish in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of about KES 5,750. 

Philister was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES 15,000 to buy additional fish stock for her business to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to help take care of her children as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue with her business with an aim of owning a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish stock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the materials needed in repairing jewelries.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a forty-five-year-old man, married to Evaline and a father of three lovely children. He runs a general store, and has been in this business for thirteen years now. Peter gets a monthly income of about KES 25,000.

This will be Peter's second loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, etc. In future he wants to open a wholesale shop and also educate the children.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale, such as sugar, maize flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Erlinda works hard to support them.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.  Erlinda is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to stock and to sell.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her previous six loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to stock and to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a married woman and the mother of a one-year-old child from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in a hog raising business. Now she needs additional capital for her ventures. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise. Through this, Marilyn will be able to improve her business and save money for reinvestment and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Munkhbaatar

texts.en:
Borrower Munkhbaatar is a 27-year-old married man who lives with his two daughters and wife in an outer ger district which lacks the basic infrastructure of the city. His wife babysits for their daughters while Munkhbaatar works at local mining company.  

He is a very hardworking young man who desires to make better living conditions for his family. He built a house last year, but it still needs some construction work. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials such as windows, fencing, cement, bricks and others.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials.

loans.name: Bella Vista Group

texts.es:
15 son las mujeres que integran este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, gracias a que cada una está luchando por crecer en el grupo y en sus emprendimientos. Están en el ciclo 6 de programa de comité y por medio de esto quieren ir creciendo.
Eustacia vende ropas de todas clases y marcas, ella es una persona con gran potencial para la venta, y es gracias a eso que le esta yendo muy bien, tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compra de ella las prendas que vende. Su meta de algún dia es poder tener un gran local de venta de prendas para poder seguir con su trabajo.
La Sra. Eustacia solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas para surtir su negocio (ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, etc), lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
15 women make up this group in the city of Encarnación and thanks to that each of them is fighting to grow in the group and in their undertakings. They are in their 6th loan cycle of the communal bank programme and through this they want to keep on growing.

Eustacia sells clothing of all kinds and brands. She is a person with a lot of potential in sales, and it's thanks to this that she is going really well. She has a strong base of customers who always buy the garments she sells. Her goal is to one day be able to have a large premises to sell clothes so she can continue with her job. 

Eustacia is applying for this loan to buy clothing to supply her business with (clothing for women, men and children, e.t.c.), which will help her to firm up her business plan, which will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
This is Antonina.  The previous loan she borrowed helped her in her business, as she was able to buy more products, which enabled her to earn a higher income.  It also helped in their household expenditures and her children's education.  In addition to her fruit and vegetable selling business, she also has a food stall and an apartment.  She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan of 35,000 PHP in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business.  Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and to meet the educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Antonina hopes to have a new stall and dreams to expand her other business.  She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is now 38 years old, married to Jackline, and a father of three children. He is a tailor and has been in this business for 14 years now, and his business is doing well and with good income. He has serviced his previous loan well.

This will be Dickson's second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy new fabric materials for making clothes. In the future he wants to be a successful businessman and also educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
El Sr. Mauro vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Encarnación, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, por quien él y su esposa se esfuerzan día a día para poder darles lo que necesitan para una vida buena.
Mauro es dueño de un negocio de venta de cubierta y servicio de gomería en su casa, desde ya hace varios años, cabe destacar que también realiza venta por las colonias por pedido. Comenta que gracias a que hace muy buen trabajo tiene buena clientela y está creciendo.
Solicita esta ayuda para poder invertir en la compra de cubiertas, ya que es su principal producto de venta y no quiere que le falte. Esta contento por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de crecer.
texts.en:
Mauro lives in his own house in the city of Encarnación; he’s married and has two children that he and his wife strive for daily to be able to give them all they need to have a good life.

Mauro has had a home-based tire-repair shop for several years now.  It’s worth pointing out that he also sells in other neighborhood to order.  He comments that thanks to his good work he has a good clientele that’s growing.

He’s asking for this help to buy hubcaps since that’s the main thing he sells and he doesn’t want to run out.  He’s happy for this growth opportunity he’s getting.

loans.use: to buy hubcaps.

loans.name: Daizy

texts.en:
Daizy lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 8 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Growing crops and rearing livestock."She took this loan in order to purchase more poultry. Her biggest challenge is "poor market for farm produce." Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Chebois.'

Daizy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "It offers good loan training." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "It gives loans with low interest rates."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Daizy replied "it will help meet family needs."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Daisy owns the following: cow and poultry, but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, and automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and running water, but does not have electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, a TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Pyapy Mbarete quiere decir brazo fuerte, para poder luchar, y eso es lo que hacen estas señoras, luchan por sus familias y sus hijos, para poder darles todo lo que no pudieron tener. Están en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se están esforzando por crecer.
Vanesa es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha y se esfuerza mucho día a día, su meta es ayudar a su familia y crecer, darles lo que necesitan y que no pasen por necesidades. Ella es empleada domestica y también se dedica al bordado. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que sus bordados gustan mucho.
Ella está solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos, agujas y demás, para poder seguir con sus bordados y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
“Pyapy Mbarete” means “strong hug” in order to fight which is what these ladies do: they fight for their families and for their children in order to be able to give them everything they themselves were unable to have.  They are in cycle #10 in the women’s committee program; they are all striving to grow.

Vanesa is a very hardworking person who strives and makes quite an effort every day.  Her goal is to help her family and to grow - to give them everything they need so they will have no wants.  She’s a domestic employee and also does embroidery.  She says that she has a very good clientele because her embroidery is well-liked.

She’s asking for this loan to buy thread, needles and others to continue with her embroidery and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Dorica, who is in her early 40s, is married and has three girls who attend school. Since 2008, she has been running two activities, selling dagaa (small dry fishes) and soft drinks.  She works from 6 AM to 9 PM daily and is able to make a very good profit each month.

This will be her 10th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  With the previous loans, all of which she repaid successfully, she purchased more dagaa, started selling soft drinks and bought a refrigerator for her business.  With the returns earned, she paid school fees, repaired her business premise, installed a door in her house, bought a nice cupboard for her utensils and purchased a plot of land.  She will use this loan to buy more dagaa and soft drinks.  She dreams to build a nice family house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Karibu View," which is comprised of 10 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more dagaa and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Porave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ñepytyvo Porave Rekavo es del Chaco, trabaja unido en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres y quieren ayudar a sus familias. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para ir creciendo y saber la situación de cada una.
Mariel, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta de masitas dulces, vende en forma ambulante, luchando para poder conseguir el sustento de cada día para la familia. Ella es una señora que decidió trabajar duro para superar la pobreza. Esta solicitando este crédito como una ayuda, para poder comprar mas masitas para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called “Ñepytyvo Porave Rekavo” is from El Chaco.  It’s working together in the second cycle in the women’s committee program and they want to help their families.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to know each of their situations.

Mariel is one of the members; she sells sweet baked goods from place to place striving to get daily sustenance for her family.  She’s a woman who decided to work hard to overcome poverty.  She’s asking for this loan as a help in order to buy more baked goods to resell thus growing and continuing to work like she’s been doing to date.

loans.use: to buy pastries to sell.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Inmaculada Concepcion está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Liduvina es la presidenta, y cuenta que su grupo está muy entusiasta para trabajar y crecer, ella las insta a trabajar y luchar por sus objetivos. Liduvina se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pantallas de karanday, la pantalla es un utensilio parecido al abanico que se utiliza para soplar, el cual ella arma con palmas y después los vende. Tiene lugares de donde recibe pedido y así trabaja para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder utilizarlo en la compra de palmas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir haciendo sus pantallas y seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called “Inmaculada Concepción” (Immaculate Conception) is in cycle #2 in the women’s committee program.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to get to know each of their situations.

Liduvina is group president and she relates that the group is very enthusiastic about working and growing.  She encourages them to work and strive towards their objectives.  Liduvina works making fans out of ‘karanday’ [a species of palm] which is a utensil similar to a fan that’s used to blow; she assembles them from palm and then sells them.  She has places that order from her and this is how she works to help her family.

She’s asking for this loan to be able to buy palm fronds so that she can continue making the shades and continue selling them like she’s been doing.

loans.use: to buy palm fronds..

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en:
Zeddy lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has two children and has been doing this work for 12 years.  Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Digging and harvesting'. Her biggest challenge is 'Insufficient funds.' An animal on the farm has been given the name of 'Lelkina.'

Zeddy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'It offers low interest rates.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Gives loans faster.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family?', Zedddy replied 'It will increase her income base.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Zeddy owns the following:poultry, cow but does not own 'pig,pump,bicycle,motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Buenos Aires Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatro  socios emprendedores, uno de ellos es Cesar hombre de 61 años de edad, casado, con dos  hijos mayores, originario de Nindiri tiene 10 años de tener un taller de calzado, su préstamo lo solicita para invertir en la compra de materia prima como cuero, pega blanca, charol, pega amarilla, lijas, hilo para coser zapatos, cuerina, suela de zapatos etc. María Teresa tiene 44 años de edad su negocio es la venta de tortillas en su domicilio y Kathya tiene 23 años de edad su negocio es la venta de bisutería y perfumen y Sonia su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y cosmeticos de la Avon.
texts.en:
This group is composed of four member entrepreneurs.  One of them is Cesar, a 61-year-old, married man with two adult children.  He’s from Nindiri and has had a shoe repair shop for ten years.  He requests the loan to buy raw materials like leather, white glue, patent leather, yellow glue, sandpaper, thread to sew shoes, faux leather, shoe soles, etc.

María Teresa, 44, has a home-based tortilla shop, Kathya, 23, sells costume jewelry and perfume and Sonia sells new clothes and Avon cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy shoe repair supplies.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has 2 children and has been doing this work for 3 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Rearing livestock for subsistence and commercial purposes' His biggest challenge is 'Access to funds for business.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lamaiywet.'

Philip was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Was introduced to juhudi by a friend.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Learnt how to benefit in agriculture by acquiring assets from mfi.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How this loan would benefit his family', Philip replied 'Will acquire a dairy cow.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Philip owns the following: 'cow, poultry, automobile' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Los Tres Pinos Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores de éxito, una de ellas es Margarita tiene 49 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos que le ayudan en el negocio, tiene 10 años de comprar y vender cosechas y se dedica a la agricultura, su esposo siembra granos como maíz, frijoles etc. quien apoya en el sustento del hogar, en su domicilio tiene cuatros cerdos de crianzas para la comercialización, es cliente de la institución cinco años los créditos anteriores les han servido en su crecimiento por que ahora compra variedad de productos, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo, cosechas de mangos, pipián etc. María tiene 34 años de edad su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio y Pedro José tiene 43 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three successful entrepreneurs.  Margarita, age 49, is one of them.  She is married and has two children who help her in the business.  She has been buying and selling harvests for ten years.  She is a farmer, and her husband grows crops like corn and beans, etc.  He helps support the household.  

She has four pigs at home that she is raising in order to sell.  She has been a client of the institution for five years.  The previous loans have served in her growth, because she now buys a variety of products.

She will use this loan to buy tamarind harvests, mango harvests, and pumpkins, etc.

María, age 34, has a grocery store business in her home.  Pedro José, age 43, has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy tamarind harvests, mango harvests, and pumpkins, etc.

loans.name: Muungano - Beach Group

texts.en:
Zainab,who is in her early 20s, is single with a baby girl who is still young. Since 2011, Zainab has been able to meet the basic needs of her family by running a beauty salon. She works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good profit per month.

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loan, she managed to restock missing salon equipment. She paid back her loan successfully. She will use this loan to again restock missing salon equipment. She dreams of owning a nursery school. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Muungano - Beach" which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her missing salon equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Conchita

texts.en:
This is Ma. Conchita, 58, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Danilo and has children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Conchita operates a buy and sell business. She buys different jewelry such as earrings, pendants and necklaces.  She sells them for a reasonable price. Payment can be cash or by instalment.  She earns a minimum of Php3000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantities and varieties of jewelry. 

Ma. Conchita hopes that her business will expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies there. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for greater quantities and varieties of jewelry needed in her business.

loans.name: O. Maria Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro  socios emprendedores una de ellas es Reyna mujer de 40 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de refrescos naturales, hielo, helados en su domicilio dicha actividad la viene realizando desde hace 8 años consecutivos en su comunidad es reconocida por su producto que vende, tiene dos hijos que le apoyan en sus ratos libres en el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como frutas naturales como naranjas, guayaba de fresco, melón, papaya, azúcar, bolsa, sal, frambuesa, maní, leche, leña, canela, etc., Olga tiene 53 años de edad y su negocio es productos de librerías y variedades, Liliam tiene 53 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y leña en su domicilio y Pedro es un hombre que tiene 53 años de edad y su negocio es taller de zapateria
texts.en:
This group has four entrepreneurs as members.  One of them is Reyna, 40, who sells natural beverages, ice and frozen treats from home.  

She’s been doing this for 8 years consecutively in her community and she’s well-known because of the product she sells.  She has two children who help her out with the business in their spare time.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials like natural fruit like oranges, guava, melon, papaya, sugar, bags, salt, raspberries, peanuts, milk, firewood, cinnamon, etc.

Olga, 53, sells stationery supplies and novelties, Liliam, 53, sells clothes and firewood at home and Pedro, 53, has a shoe repair shop.

loans.use: to buy fruit, cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. He has no children and has been doing his work for six years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Earning from agriculture to meet family needs' His biggest challenge is 'Lack of financial support to maximise production.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Shadrack was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Was introduced to Juhudi by members of Juhudi group.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Learnt how one could boost production through acquisition of funds from Juhudi.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family', Shadrack replied 'Will purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Shadrack owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase water tanks and water pipes

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Juan es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es una ciudad un poco distante, y que aun está en vías de desarrollo, la mayoría de las integrantes son de colonias muy alejadas y con difícil acceso.
La señora Gavina es la presidenta en el comité es muy trabajadora, formo su grupo para poder trabajar en conjunto y salir adelante, e ir mejorando también su comunidad por medio del comité. Ella se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, que vende o faena, por medio de este trabajo está ayudando a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para vivir.
Ella quiere ir mejorando la vida de su familia, y ve como una gran oportunidad el de formar este grupo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de animales para la cría, ya que así podrá seguir con su trabajo y teniendo un poco mas de ingresos. Agradece la oportunidad que ellas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The San Juan group is from the city of Curuguaty.  It is a city that is a little far away and that is still developing.  Most of the members are from neighborhoods that are very far away and very difficult to access.

Gavina is the president of the communal bank, and she is very hard-working.  She formed her group in order to be able to work together, to get ahead, and to also improve her community through the communal bank.

She raises barnyard animals that she sells or slaughters.  Through this work she is helping her family, and she gives them what they need to live.  She wants to improve her family life.  She sees forming this group as a great opportunity 

She is requesting this loan to buy animals to raise.  This way she will be able to continue her work and have a little more income.  She is grateful for the opportunity that they are getting.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and sell or slaughter.

loans.name: Teebeh

texts.en: Teebeh is 46 years old and lives at Paynesville North, which has the largest local market in Montsorrade. She’s married and her husband is an electrician. They have seven children between 13 and 30 years old and only two of them are in school and live at home. She described herself as one who is family oriented. For the past months, she has been selling bread, biscuits, soft drinks, cookies, etc. in her community. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She sells every day from 7 AM to 9 PM and she started this business with a loan from BRAC Liberia. Using a shared taxi, she gets her goods to her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread, biscuits, soft drinks, cookies, etc. for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, biscuits, soft drinks, cookies, etc.  for her business,

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos y vive en una colonia del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara junto a sus hijos y una hermana. El siempre se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos de agricultura, pero hace un año el decidió tener un ingreso fijo y estableció su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende refrescos, pan, manteca, harina, arroz, etc. El quiere ver su negocio más surtido y ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras para comprar más productos como arroz, pan, refrescos, azúcar, manteca, huevos y otros. Su plan es crecer con el negocio para mejorar su nivel de vida y de su familia.
texts.en: Jorge is 33 years old and single. He has two children. He lives in the city of Quimistán in Santa Bárbara with his children and a sister. He has  worked always in agriculture but a year ago, he decided to earn a regular income. He set up a grocery business where he sells soft drinks, bread, butter, flour, rice, etc. He wants his business to have more of a selection. He has decided to request a loan for 6,000 Lempiras in order to purchase more products like rice, bread, soft drinks, butter, eggs and other items. His plan is to grow his business in order improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: purchase rice, bread, soft drinks, butter, eggs and other items for his grocery store.

loans.name: San Cayetano 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano 2 está en su ciclo número 9º del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son madres de familia que decidieron luchar con sus manos por lograr un mejor estilo de vida para sus familias, están comprometidas a ello y trabajan arduamente.
Domitilia es una de las integrantes, quien demuestra que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa  se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, entre el trabajo que ella hace es la venta de producto de limpieza, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos de limpieza para la venta, lo cual le ayudará a seguir creciendo y mejorando poco a poco en su negocio. Agradece por la ayuda que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo, ya que no solo ellas se ven beneficiadas sino su familia entera
texts.en:
The San Cayetano 2 group is in its 9th cycle with the Women’s Committee Program.  They are mothers who decided to struggle with their hands to achieve a better lifestyle for their families.  They are committed to it, and they work arduously.

Domitilia is one of the members.  She demonstrates that through effort, continual work, and by applying the vital behaviors of a successful woman she is improving her poverty situation.  She sells cleaning products, and through this work she helps her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy cleaning products to sell.  This will help her to continue growing and improving, little by little, her business.  She is grateful for the help that she and her friends are receiving.  Not only will they see the benefits, but the entire family will, too.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Enoch

texts.en: Enoch lives in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is noted for producing fish. He is 35 years old, and a junior high school dropout. He described himself as a studious and focused person. He is married and his wife sells clothes as well. They have four children between the ages of 5 and 14 who are in school and live at home. Enoch has been running a shop since 2004 where he sells cosmetics, fashion clothing such as T-shirt, blouses, jeans, and trousers. He sells six days a week from 7AM to 6PM. He likes his business because his business keeps him busy. He started this business after selling for his sister years ago. He uses a shared bus to enable him to get his goods to his shop. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics and fashion clothing such as t-shirts, blouses, jeans and trousers for his business. His plan is to turn his business in to a bigger one and educate his children. He would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia and to please continue helping business people to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and fashion clothing such as t-shirts, blouses, jeans and trousers.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya. She has two children and has been doing farming for twelve years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Earning from milk sales to provide for the family. Her biggest challenge is, “access to better financial institutions with tailor-made products for farmers.” Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Cheptil”.

Evaline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “(I) joined Juhudi after seeing a friend benefit from Juhudi.”  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and replied, “Learnt how microfinance institutions/Juhudi works to boost farmers’ income and living standards.”

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Evaline replied, “Will put up a dairy unit.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Evaline owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 42 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She was unable to attend school, but she says she is good at managing business and home affairs. She is single and has nine children between the ages of 7 and 22. Only three are in school and live at home. For the past twelve years, she has been selling rice, oil, sugar flour, and other items from a small shop in the community.  She sells from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. six days a week. She get her goods at her shop by means of a taxi. She has a lot of customers and makes a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ice, oil, sugar flour, and other items for her business. She hopes to improve her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more ice, oil, sugar flour, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, está casada con Rubén y juntos tienes 3 hijos de 24, 21 y 11 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia junto a toda su familia.Digna se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, entre los que se encuentran; arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras y más. Este negocio lo tiene en su hogar en donde atiende todos los días y a tiempo completo. Lleva trabajando 2 años en este rubro. Complementa su bodega con la venta diferentes prendas de vestir, zapatos y cosméticos.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales entre ellas las principales funciones de su hogar, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes gracias a la variedad de los productos que ofrece y porque además es la única tienda en su zona.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2200 soles para comprar golosinas, arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche, aceites verduras y otros.
texts.en:
Digna, 39, is an enterprising woman who very much wants to make progress.  She’s married to Rubén and they have three children together who are 24, 21, and 11 years of age respectively; she lives in her own house with her entire family.

Digna works selling groceries among which are rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, vegetables and others.  She has her store at home and she’s open every day full-time.  She’s been in this line of work for two years.  

She complements the grocery sales with clothing, shoes and cosmetics sales.  What she enjoys about her work is that it leaves her with time to do other things among which are her main household chores.  Fortunately, she does very well because she always has customers thanks to the variety of goods she offers and because she’s the only store in the area.  

On this occasion, she will ask for 2,200 soles to buy snacks, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables and others.

loans.use: to buy snacks, rice, sugar and bread, among others.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 21 años de edad, es una joven mujer, amable y muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene un hijo pequeño, vive en casa de sus padres,junto a su familia .La actividad que realiza Luz es la venta de comidas típicas de la zona y asados de carnes como pollo, cerdo y pescado, para ello instala su mesa en el frontis de su casa, desde ahí atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Lleva en este negocio un promedio de 3 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su madre para la preparación de los potajes y la atención de los clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y transeúntes. En la actualidad brinda desayunos a los obreros de un aserradero cercano a su vivienda.Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y la necesidades de  su pequeño hijo quien es la motivación para seguir progresando, por lo contrario no le gusta cuando los precios de su insumos suben reduciendo sus ganancias pero aun así logra encontrar la rentabilidad en sus ventas, tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y mantenerlo, ampliandoló con mejores sillas y mesas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3500 soles y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para seguir adelante. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará todos los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas tales como arroz, aceites, papas y demás.
texts.en:
Luz, 21, is a young, kind, very hardworking woman; she’s single and has a little boy.  She lives in her parents’ house with her family.  

The activity Luz carries out is selling food that’s typical of the zone as well as grilled meats like chicken, pork and fish.  To do so, she sets up a table in front of her house and from there kindly and cordially tends to her customers.  She’s been in this business for about three years and her mother helps her prepare the dishes and to take care of customers who for the most part are her neighbors and passersby.  She currently provides breakfasts for the employees at a nearby sawmill.  

She likes her business because it makes it possible for her to earn income to cover household expenses and her small son’s needs that is her motivation to continue making progress.  What she doesn’t like, on the other hand, is when the price of ingredients rises thus cutting into her profits but even so she manages to make profits from her sales.  She plans to continue with her business and to keep it going expanding it with better tables and chairs to provide more comfort for her customers.

On this occasion she will ask for 3,500 soles and she’s very happy that she’ll have financial support to continue forward.  On the other hand, she commits once again to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested amount to buy all the ingredients like rice, oil, potatoes and others needed to prepare the dishes.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and meat, among others.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old and married to Margaret. They are blessed with one child aged two years old. Joseph has been in the transportation business for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES. 5,000. 

He joined KADET LTD where he is taking his first loan of KES. 20,000, which will allow him to repair his broken motorbike.

Joseph is planning to purchase another motorbike in order to expand his business. With the anticipated profit from his expanded business he will purchase a plot of land. His hopes and dreams are to be rich and educate his child.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 32 years old, married, and a mother of two children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling household items in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 14,800 KES.

Caroline was introduced to KADET by a credit officer and she is applying for her first loan. This loan of KES.30, 000 will help purchase additional stock, such as new basins, lamps, water buckets and such other items to sell to her clients. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children. Caroline's goal for the future is to own a well-established general store in the area so as to help improve her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Moajb

texts.en:
Moajb is 25 years old, married and has one child who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. His educational background is college educated. 

He is hard-working, determined and does not fear challenges. He is a soldier who earns a low salary. Besides his salary, he has been selling recharge mobile cards which he uses to increase his income and cover household expenses. Recently, he suffered from a lack of customers which led to a low income. So, he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy recharge mobile cards to expand his business. He dreams that his family will have a better quality of life and in addition he will be able to expand his business which will qualify him to open a bigger call centre.

loans.use: to buy recharge mobile cards to expand his business.

loans.name: Wendy Carolina

texts.es: Wendy, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Quimistan, Santa Bárbara. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace 4 años que inicio su propio negocio de venta de mercadería en general como ropa, zapatos, sandalias y otros que le piden sus clientes. El negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa. Ella ha mantenido el negocio mediante la inversión de tres préstamos anteriores. Actualmente solicita el cuarto préstamo el cual es por 12,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar ropa usada surtida como blusas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, zapatos y otros. Su objetivo es crecer cada dia con su negocio para lograr superarse como persona y poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Wendy is 41 years old. She is a single mother with three children. She lives in the city of Quimistan in Santa Bárbara department. Wendy has always been involved in the commercial sector. Four years ago, she started her own business selling general merchandise like clothing, shoes, sandals and other items that customers request.  The business was set up in her home.  She has maintained her business through three previous loans. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 lempiras. With this loan, she will purchase assorted used clothing like blouses, pants, dresses, skirts, shoes and other products. Her objective is to grow her business every day in order to get ahead and to support her family.

loans.use: purchase assorted used clothing like blouses, pants, dresses, skirts, shoes and other products to sell.

loans.name: Analia

texts.es: Analia, de 33 años, es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos, actualmente vive junto a toda su familia en la casa de su madre debido a que sufrió algunos inconvenientes en su casa propia.Analia se dedica a la venta de esmaltes de uñas, cofres decorativos, adornos, monederos, ganchos de cabello, algunas prendas de vestir, juguetes, algodón, espejos, entre otros. Tiene una vitrina en donde coloca sus productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Se inició en esta actividad hace 6 meses con pocos productos que ofrecer por lo que no lograba tener buenas ventas durante el día, eso la desanimaba a menudo, sin embargo poco a poco fue implementando su pequeño puesto de ventas y ahora vende mucho más que antes.Lo que más le gusta de su labor es intercambiar con sus clientes instantes de felicidad, conversar con ellos y verlos empezar el día con una sonrisa, considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano, sobre todo cuando se siente cansada, sin embargo, sabe que es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, además le agrada pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.Con el monto solicitado comprará artículos femeninos como aretes, adornos, cofres y carteras para que sus ventas continúen.
texts.en:
Analia, age 33, is a responsible and very hard-working woman.  She has a life partner and three children.  She currently lives with her whole family in her mother’s house.  This is because they suffered from some difficulties in her own house.

Analia sells nail polish, decorative boxes, decorations, wallets, hair clips, some clothing, toys, cotton, and mirrors, among others.  She has a display case where she places her products to offer to her customers.

Six months ago she started with few products to offer.  Therefore, she did not manage to have good sales during the day.  This often discouraged her.  Nonetheless, she was, little by little, getting things in place in her small sales stand.  Now she sells a lot more than before.  What she likes most about her work is the happy moments of exchange with her customers, talking with them, and seeing them start the day with a smile.  She feels that the most difficult part is having to get up early, most of all when she is tired.  Nevertheless, she knows that it is her work, and she has to do it.

She will now request 1,000 soles.  She is very happy to know that she has a financial support.  This way she feels more secure about advancing with her work.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  Also, she is grateful to belong to her communal bank.  All of the members are very responsible and supportive.  She will use the requested loan to buy feminine items like earrings, decorations, boxes, and wallets so that her sales continue.

loans.use: to buy earrings, decorations, and boxes, among other items.

loans.name: Milituna

texts.en:
Milituna has been in the gasoline retail business for more than a year now. This source of income helps her husband in supporting the needs of the family, especially the schooling of her children.

Militona is requesting a loan to buy more gasoline to sell. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline.

loans.name: Duvin

texts.es: Duvin, está casado, tiene la edad de 45 años y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos y plaguicidas para mejorar su siembra. El cuenta ya con varios años de trabajar como agricultor de granos básicos por lo cual quiere invertir en su siembra para poder obtener mas ganancias al final de su cosecha. El espera para la cosecha poder alcanzar el máximo de producción y venderla para generar buenas ganancias y poder salir adelante con los pagos de su crédito y mejorar su estabilidad económica para su futuro. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Duvin is married.  He is 45 years old and he lives with his wife who is his highest priority.  He intends to buy supplies like manure and insecticides with this loan in order to improve his crop.  He already has several years working as a farmer of basic grains and therefore he wants to invest in his crop in order to obtain more profit at the end of the harvest.  He hopes the harvest can reach maximum production and that he can sell it in order to generate good profits and be able to get ahead with the loan payments and improve his financial stability for his future.  

This is the second loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not had other loans from state banks before but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to attend to his corn crop.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica's business has gained great momentum. She has been able to pay for the previous loans well, besides meeting her family’s needs. There is also a great demand for food stock in the area. She would like to set up a new stall for business.

Monica is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to construct a new stall and buy a stock of fruits and vegetables for sale. She will use the extra income to construct a house.

loans.use: to purchase stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a Escola e o outro já maior de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante vende frangos de abate e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (pintos, ração, vitaminas, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja investir mais no negócio construindo capoeiras maiores para albergar grandes quantidades de frangos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de se empenhar para tornar o seu negócio sustentável para oferecer mais conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Rosa is a widow and has three children. Two of her children attend school and the other one is already an adult. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who sells broiler chickens. With the current loan she intends to purchase supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, etc.) in order to increase the amount of her merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to invest more in her business by building larger coops that can harbor a high number of chickens. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working hard in order to keep her business afloat, so that she can provide more comfort for her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, etc.) in order to increase the amount of her merchandise.

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operária agrícola e negociante vende roupa usada e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa e material de construção para aumentar a sua mercadoria e melhorar a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja ter uma casa confortável e fazer crescer o seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é criar mecanismos de conseguir mais rendimento para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Helena is married and has four children who attend school. She lives in a house that she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a farm worker and a merchant who sells used clothing. With the current loan she intends to purchase bundles of clothing and construction supplies in order to stock up on merchandise and improve her home.
Her wish for the future is to have a comfortable house and make her business grow. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is creating ways to increase her income so that she can accomplish all her projects.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothing and construction supplies in order to stock up on merchandise and improve her home.

loans.name: Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
Mabula, who is in his early 40s, is married with three children who are still going to school. He has been selling ground nuts and has been a mason for ten years now. He works from 8.00 am to 5.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mabula's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his ground nut stock. He has also used them to buy items for his masonry job. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to buy sand, paid school school fees, and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to  buy and sell more ground nuts and to buy better equipment for his masonry job. His dream is to one day be able to build and finish his house.

Mabula will share this loan with his loan group "Tupendane B" of eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy and sell more ground nuts and to buy better equipment for his masonry job.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru. He also has an M-PESA shop, which he has operated for one year.

He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a dairy cow. He paid his previous loan on time.

He hopes to start a large-scale farming business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais um sobrinho que vive com ela.
É negociante vende produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (frangos, peru, refrescos, óleo, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio ampliando o seu estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais para vencer a concorrência e mais rendimento para iniciar com a obra da sua casa.
texts.en:
Ana is single and has a son who attends school. She lives in a house that she owns and also supports a nephew who lives with her.
She's a merchant who sells various products. With the current loan she intends to purchase goods (chickens, turkey, refreshments, cooking oil, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to make her business grow by expanding her store. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is working harder in order to beat the competition, and also earning more profits so she can begin construction work in her house.

loans.use: to purchase goods (chickens, turkey, refreshments, cooking oil, etc.) in order to stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
This is Nelia, 55, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Constantino, an employee, and mother to her children. She, her husband and children manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nelia operates a food processing business. She has a factory a few steps from her house that manufactures meat products. She earns by selling her goods to her neighbors, the local community and suppliers, earning a minimum of Php400 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, Nelia is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her product inventory.

Nelia dreams of expanding her business in order to improve their living conditions. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for processed and frozen foods needed in her business.

loans.name: Tatenda Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 36 year old Shillah from Masvingo. Shillah a is single parent with three children, all of whom are attending school.  Shillah runs a retail business which sells electrical gadgets, clothes, and groceries. The business has been in operation for 12 years. She says the main challenge she is facing is of the high transportation costs of ferrying goods from the wholesaler to her shop. Shillah has requested a loan of $1000 to buy electrical gadgets, pots, and groceries for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to boost her family welfare. In the future Shillah plans to buy a commercial stand and build her own block of shops.

loans.use: to buy electrical gadgets, pots, and groceries

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en:
A hardworking and diligent woman, 38-year-old Noureen lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and three children. Only two of her children are going to school because she can’t afford the educational expenses of all. Her husband is a wood cutter by profession and he has a very low monthly income.

Noureen is a very responsible and skilled woman using her tailoring skills to generate an additional source of income for her family. She has been stitching clothes and dresses for 14 years, and her clients are very well satisfied with her work.

Noureen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to open a tailoring center and needs to purchase two new sewing machines. She will reinvest her profits in her business and pay her children's educational expenses. She desires to send all of her children to school and is very hopeful that the loan will result in progress for her family.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 28-year-old single lady. She is running a printing and photocopy shop which has been in operation for a period of about one year with an income of approximately KES.35,000 
 
She is taking the second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use the loan to buy more printing machines. She hopes to open up more outlets in other towns.

loans.use: to buy more printing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items like soap, oil, etc.

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.ru:
Николай женат. У него есть маленькая дочь. Николая имеет свой бизнес.

Николай занимается выращиванием овощей на протяжении пяти лет. Наиболее продаваемыми являются помидоры, огурцы и редис. Николай трудолюбивый и общительный, хочет развивать бизнес. Ему не хватает своих средств на весенний сезон, поэтому он хочет воспользоваться кредитом.

Николай просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на закупку удобрений(8 тыс. гривен), средств химической обработки(3 тыс. гривен) и системы полива(4 тыс. гривен). С полученной прибыли он планирует  выкупить соседний участок и построить там новые теплицы.
texts.en:
Nikolay is married.  He has a young daughter.  Nikolay has his own business.

Nikolay has been growing vegetables for 5 years.  His bestsellers are tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes.  Nikolay is hardworking and social, he would like to grow his business.  He does not have enough resources for the spring season and this is why he would like to get a loan. 

Nikolay is asking for a loan of 15,000 hryvnia for the purchase of fertilizer (8 thousand hryvnia), chemical treatments (3 thousand hryvnia) and an irrigation system (4 thousand hryvnia).  He plans to use his income to purchase a neighboring plot and build new greenhouses there.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, means of chemical treatment and an irrigation system

loans.name: Zaira

texts.ru:
Заира занимается продажей женской  и детской одежды на протяжении 17 лет. Торговая точка собственная, находится на центральном рынке города. Заира всегда выбирает качественный товар. Она отзывчивая и трудолюбивая. 

Благодаря прибыли, полученной с вложения в бизнес предыдущего кредита Заира смогла расширить свой бизнес – приобрести еще одну торговую точку.

В этот раз Заира просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 7000 гривен на закупку летнего товара. Кредит поможет увеличить доход. Дополнительную прибыль Заира хочет продолжать влаживать прибыль в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zaira has been selling women’s and children’s clothing for 17 years. She owns her own sales stand at her town’s Central market. Zaira always selects quality merchandise. She is thoughtful and hard-working.

Thanks to the revenues earned after her prior loan, Zaira has been able to expand her business by buying an additional sales stand.
This time Zaira is applying for a loan in the amount 7,000 UAH to stock up on merchandise for the summer season. This loan will allow her to increase her revenues. Zaira would like to invest her additional profits into future growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза добросовестная, целеустремлённая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности, которое имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Семья Дилнозы была  малообеспеченной и она с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству и выращивания сельхоз культур. Сама Дилноза, перенесла, много тяготи жизни, так как жила в малообеспеченной семье. После окончания средней школы, Дилноза вышла замуж на животновода и помогала мужу по животноводству и выращиванием сельхоз культур. В основном они занимались скотоводством, то есть из базара покупали скот по низкой цене, на определённое время откармливали  и перепродали по высокой цене. Из-за неблагополучной погоды и климата их бизнес не дал положительных результатов, Поэтому муж Дилнозы собирается  уехать на заработки в Федерацию России. Поэтому Дилноза обращалась  в нашу организацию с целью получения займа для покупки авиабилета для мужа, а сама хочет продолжить бизнес по скотоводству.  Дилноза очень надеется на Вашу благотворительность и милосердие.
texts.en: Dilnoza is a conscientious, goal oriented and hardworking woman.  She was born in an agricultural area that has good conditions for raising livestock and growing crops.  Dilnoza's family was poor and she helped her parents since childhood with raising livestock and growing crops.  Dilnoza herself has had a lot of hardships in life, because she lived in a poor family.  After finishing high school, Dilnoza married a livestock breeder and helped her husband raise livestock and grow crops.  They mostly raised livestock, purchasing livestock at the market at a low price, fattening it for a period of time and selling it at a high price.  Because of unfortunate weather and climate their business did not have positive returns.  Because of this, Dilnoza's husband plans to travel to earn money in the Russian Federation.  This is why Dilnoza turned to our organization for a loan for the purchase of a plane ticket for her husband; she plans to continue raising livestock.  Dilnoza hopes for your charity and mercy.

loans.use: to buy an airplane ticket for her husband

loans.name: Soda

texts.fr: Madame Soda est une femme mariée et elle vit au Sénégal. Son activité économique est la confection d’habits. Cela fait à présent plus de 03 qu’elle fait de la couture, et c’est la   seule activité qu’elle a exercé. Elle est adhérente à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt de 50.000 francs CFA prévu pour se  ravitailler en denrées alimentaires (riz, huile…) au bénéfice de  sa petite famille. En effet, ce montant lui permettra de rendre meilleur les conditions alimentaires de sa famille et notamment de prendre soin de son bébé. Elle souhaite un jour avoir son propre magasin.
texts.en:
Soda is a married woman who lives in Senegal and whose economic activity consists in sewing clothes.  She has been working as a seamstress for over three years now, and this is the only activity she has been involved in.

Soda is a client of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC and she is requesting a loan of 50,000 CFA francs to buy food supplies (rice, oil..) to support her family.  Her loan will indeed help her to improve her family's food conditions and to take care of her baby.  

Soda would like to have her own store one day.

loans.use: to buy food supplies to contribute to her family's food management.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou est une femme mariée  qui habite dans une des localités villageoises du Sénégal et évolue dans le secteur du petit commerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle vend des produits alimentaires saisonniers  et les revenus qu’elle gagne lui  permettent de participer  à la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits saisonniers  a revendre. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille  et  épargner de  l’argent. Son projet futur consiste a acquérir une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
Seynabou is a married woman who lives in a village in Senegal.  She has been involved in small retail for more than 15 years, selling seasonal food products.  With her earnings, she is able to participate in the management of her family's daily expenses.

Seynabou is a client of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC, and she is requesting a loan of 50,000 CFA francs to buy seasonal products for resale.  Her goal is to improve her family's food conditions and to save some money.

In the future, she plans to have a shop where she could sell food supplies.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Née vers 1989 à BAMAKO, DJENEBA vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
DJENEBA n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l école,  très vite s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’habits bogolan. DJENEBA est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité  importante de pagnes bogolan auprès des  grossistes dans le village Dogon. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché Ouelessebougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
DJENEBA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in Bamako around 1989, Djeneba lives with her three children and her husband in a monogamous family setting, in the N'tentou neighborhood of the town of Ouelessebougou.

Djeneba did not have the opportunity to go to school, so she got involved in income-generating activities at a very young age, buying and selling Bogolan clothes in particular. ["Bogolan", also called "mud cloth", is a hand-made Malian cotton traditionally dyed with fermented mud].

This is her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.  She will use this loan to buy large quantities of Bogolan fabrics from wholesalers in the village of Dogon.  She sells her goods for cash or on credit, from home or at the Ouelessebougou market, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

Djeneba hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs which will be used to help her husband meet the needs of the family, to repay her loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Farima

texts.fr:
Née vers 1977 à BANGASSI, FARIMA vit avec ses 3 enfants et son époux dans une  famille polygame dans le quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
FARIMA n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l école,  très vite elle s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de friperie et de pagnes bazin.  Après avoir correctement remboursé le prêt précédent, FARIMA est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 balles de friperie   et  20 pièces de bazin auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché Ouelessebougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
FARIMA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1977 in Bangassi, Farima lives with her three children and her husband in a polygamous family setting, in the N'tentou neighborhood of the town of Ouelessebougou.

Farima did not have the opportunity to go to school, so she got involved in income-generating activities at a very young age, buying and selling used clothing and damask "pagnes" in particular (colorful West-African fabrics).

Having duly repaid a previous loan, Farima is taking her second loan with Soro Yiriwaso.  She will use her loan to buy two bales of used clothing and 20 sets of damask fabrics from wholesalers.  She sells her goods for cash or on credit, from home or at the Ouelessebougou market, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

Farima is hoping to make a monthly profit of 80,000 CFA francs, which will be used to help her husband meet the needs of the family, to repay her loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 30ans, Amavi est mariée à un employé dans une société de la place. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle revend depuis 2003 des pagnes, des produits de beauté et des produits pharmaceutiques de façon ambulante. Elle espère agrandir son activité et assurer l’avenir de sa famille s’est pour cela, elle sollicite pour une première fois un crédit à WAGES. Ce montant l’aidera à acheter des marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire les clients.
texts.en:
