Amavi, aged 30, is a young woman who is married to an employee in a local company.  In order to meet her family's needs, she has been reselling "pagnes" (colorful fabrics), beauty products and pharmaceutical goods, door-to-door, since 2003.

As she would like to expand her activity and to provide a good future for her family, Amavi is requesting her first loan from WAGES.  Her loan amount will help her to buy some merchandise, in order to better meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy retail merchandise (fabrics, beauty products and pharmaceutical goods).

loans.name: Alex Edgardo

texts.es: Alex, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un hijo, vive en una aldea del municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Alex trabajaba en una empresa privada y al quedar sin empleo decidió poner su propio negocio. Hace un año que  vende sandalias y ropa para niños. En el negocio le ayuda una de sus sobrinas. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante. Él esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF  que es por 20,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar sandalias de todo tipo para vender. Su plan es crecer con el negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Alex is 24 years old, single and has a son. He lives in a village in the municipality of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Alex worked for a private company, and after losing his job he decided to start his own business. He has sold sandals and children's clothes for a year, and one of his nieces helps him with the business. He makes his sales in a variety of locations. Alex is requesting his second loan through Kiva partner ODEF, and he plans to use it to purchase all kinds of sandals to sell. His plan is to grow with the business and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of sandals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 50 años, es madre soltera de una hija con quien vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Juana consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, se encarga de realizar sus propios diseños, además arregla otras prendas que le solicitan sus clientes ya que confían en que ella hará un buen trabajo, tiene un taller pequeño en su casa y desde ahí realiza toda su labor, se inició en su trabajo hace 15 años, empezó realizando trabajos simples y la experiencia que ha obtenido ahora le permiten crear prendas mas complejas dándoles un buen acabado y detalles personalizados, trabaja sola y está contenta de hacer lo que le gusta.Le esta yendo muy bien, ya que tiene muchos clientes quienes la buscan muy a menudo .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales.Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales tales como telas, hilos, elásticos y moldes para confeccionar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en: Juana is a 50-year-old single mother of a daughter, whom she lives with in her own home. Juana makes a living sewing clothes and is responsible for making her own designs. She also alters other items her customers bring in because they are confident she will do a good job. She has a small workshop in her home where she carries out all of her work. She started out 15 years ago doing simple jobs, and the experience she has gained has allowed her to create more complex garments with customized details. She works alone and is happy to do what she loves. The business is going very well, since she has a lot of customers who often seek her out. She is requesting a loan, and she is grateful for the opportunity you are providing so she can carry out her business plans. With the money, she plans to purchase materials like fabrics, threads, elastic and molds to increase her output.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, elastic, threads, molds and other items.

loans.name: Martha Arely

texts.es: La señora Martha, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en la comunidad llamada La Francia junto a su esposo e hijos, ella sueña que en un futuro pueda mejorar sus condiciones de vida y poder  terminar de construir su casa, su esposo le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que el trabaja para una empresa privada y ella es comerciante de Frytas y verduras, su casa queda hubicada cerca de la carretera por lo que  que ha aprovechado la afluencia de personas para establecer su negocio, con este credito comprara Frutas y Verduras ya que sus clientes cada vez le exigen un poco mas de variedad. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Martha lives in the municipality Ticuantepe in the community called “La Francia” (The France) with her husband and children. She dreams that in the future where she can improve her living conditions and be able to build her home. Her husband helps her with the costs of the household since he works for a private company. She sells fruits and vegetables. Her home is located near the highway and she has been able to benefit from the wealth of people to create her business. 

With this loan she will buy fruits and vegetables because her clients request more variety. She is grateful for the help of Afodenic and Kiva lenders for the help provided.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
DJEKAFO est un groupe de l’association BENKADICOULOU de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec au moins quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de SIGA qui est la personne  assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
SIGA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de condiment. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiments alimentaires : des paniers d’oignon, choux, poivre, tomates fraîches et aubergines.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djekafo is the name of a group within the Benkadicoulou association of Ouelessebougou. It is composed of women who know each other as relatives and neighbors. They average 35 years of age. All are married, with four children or more each. They engage in various business activities, such as reselling condiments, which is the case of Siga, the first one seated on the left in the photo. They live in traditional extended families in Ouelessebougou, in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Mali).

They have been working as vendors for some years and are well-known. With the goal of meeting growing customer demand, two years ago the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their third solidarity loan.
Siga, the group’s leader and very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels at sending condiments. She plans to use this loan to buy food condiments: baskets of onions, cabbage, pepper, fresh tomatoes and eggplants [aubergines]. She stocks up in Bamako and locally, buying from wholesalers, and retails her condiments in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women.
She hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
BALIMAYA est un groupe de l’association KANKELE de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, sont. mariées  et mères de  3 enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de MINATA qui est la personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
MINATA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  2 sacs d’oignon,  2 paniers de choux, ½  sac sel et 1 carton de concentrée de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
The BALIMAYA group is part of the KANKELE association of Ouelessebougou.  The group consists of four women who know one another through family and neighborhood ties.  They are, on average, 30 years old, married, and also have an average of three children each.  They are involved in various activities, such as buying and selling condiments, which is the case of Minata, sitting first from the right in the photo.  These four women live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, Cercle of Kati (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).  They have been involved in small retail for several years and their goods are in high demand.

Eager to meet the increasing needs of their customers, the members of this group decided two years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso.  They are on their third solidarity loan.

Minata, the group's leader, is very well-known in Ouelessebougou, as she excels in the sale of condiments.  She plans to use her loan to buy two bags of onions, two baskets of cabbage, half a bag of salt and one box of tomato concentrate.  She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako and also locally, and she resells her condiments in Ouelessebougou, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

She is hoping to make a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es: Doña Camila, una señora soltera que sola busca como seguir adelante en la vida, ya sus hijos son casados e independientes, aunque ellos le ayuden no es igual ya que tienen sus propias responsabilidades, ella lucha con su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, cosmeticos, es su único medio de ingresos con los que paga sus gastos principales del hogar, es por eso que ella necesita invertir siempre en productos para mantenerse, con el crédito que solicita comprara ropa, calzado, cosméticos entre otros, ya que no tiene mucho que ofrecer a los clientes.
texts.en: Camila is a single woman who only seeks to get ahead in life. Her children are married and independent, and although they help her it is not the same since they have their own responsibilities. Camila fights with her small business selling clothes and cosmetics. It is her only means of income so she can pay the bills, and it is for this reason she needs to always invest in products to sustain it. With the loan, she plans to purchase clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other items, since she does not have much to offer her customers at the moment.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 37-year-old man, married to Esther and the father of three lovely children. He does dairy farming in Limuru and has been doing so for sixteen years now. He gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Julius' second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future he wants to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is a 54-year-old living in Cagay-anon, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her 2 children. To make a living she's buying and selling fish in the local community, earning 3,000 a month. She's been doing this for 23 years just to help her husband. In 2008, she joined GDMPC microfinance and is now requesting a loan of 7,000 for additional capital. She plans to repair their house for better living.

loans.use: to add capital

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is a 53-year-old hardworking mother of 5 children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and children. She is a very skilled woman, and she is very expert in stitching up dresses. She has been doing this tailoring work for 5 years. All the people in her area are well satisfied and happy with her work. She provides her services at a very reasonable amount; that's why her work is increasing day by day. 

Haseena has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. She would be able to stitch dresses more appropriately and efficiently in less time with a new sewing machine. This would increase her net income and savings. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine to stitch dresses

loans.name: Gredel

texts.es:
Gredel, de 42 años de edad es una mujer buena, amable y alegre, esta casada con Kelin y fruto de su matrimonio tiene dos hijos de 23 y 21 años de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia.
Gredel se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, entre los cuales tiene productos de belleza, perfumería y cosméticos como talcos, cremas de manos, cremas faciales, lociones, polvos compactos, lápiz labial y otros accesorios femeninos como aretes, collares y anillos, además también ofrece a la venta algunas prendas de vestir de temporada que trae de otras ciudades para venderlos bajo el sistema crediticio entre sus amigas, vecinas, familiares y compañeros de trabajo. Lleva realizando esta actividad por mas de 20 años y le esta yendo muy bien, además de cumplir esta labor también es profesora de un centro educativo de la ciudad y eso le permite tener potenciales clientes y vender mucho más aparte de cumplir con su trabajo.Inició su actividad cuando vio la necesidad de solventar los gastos de sus estudios, ya que en ese entonces aun era estudiante y necesitaba tener algún ingreso económico, poco a poco fue progresando, hasta que egresó y pudo también trabajar paralelamente en lo que había estudiado, pero aun así siguió con su trabajo comercial.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan ya que puede seguir adelante con su trabajo además se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará productos de belleza como talcos, cremas, lociones y otros accesorios femeninos.
texts.en:
Gredel is 42-years-old and is a good woman who is nice and friendly. She is married to Kelin and from her marriage she has two children who are 23 and 21 years old.  They live together in their own home. 

Gredel works in the sale of cosmetics including beauty products, perfume, and cosmetics such as talcum powder, hand cream, facial cream, lotions, compact powder, lipstick, and other feminine accessories like earrings, necklaces, and rings.  Additionally she offers some clothing articles by season that she brings from other cities to sell them through credit to her friends, neighbors, family members, and co-workers. She has been working in this activity for 20 years and she is doing very well. In addition to doing this work, she is also a professor in an educational center and this allows her to have potential clients and sell more in addition to completing her work. She began this work when she realized the need to settle her education expenses and at the time she was a student and needed to generate income. Little by little she progressed until she graduated and could work in parallel with what she had studied, but she continued to work in sales. 

She is requesting 2500 sol. She is very happy for the financial help provided so she can continue ahead with her work. She promises to punctually pay her quotas. She will use the loan to purchase beauty products such as talcum power, creams, lotions and other feminine products.

loans.use: to purchase feminine products such as perfumes, talcum powder, earrings, necklaces, and other items

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann resides in Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya, with her husband. She has been a farmer for over twenty years, producing and selling cereals. Besides farming, she has a retail business as an extra source of income.

She wants to venture into poultry farming and has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo for purchasing poultry. Her major challenges are: crop pests and diseases, poor markets, and insufficient funds. In the next five years, she wants to have over 5,000 poultry, both layers and broilers. This loan will improve her family's living standards. She is happy with Juhudi Kilimo because of its better and quick services.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Rosa Amabel

texts.es: Doña rosa se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de pollos tiene una mini granja, tiene mucha experiencia en esa actividad que le ha generado buenas ganancias para poder cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella vive con su esposo y su hijo, doña rosa desea continuar con su trabajo pero no cuenta con los insumos necesarios por eso solita un crédito para poder comprar concentrado, vitaminas y mas pollos para seguir con su trabajo y obtener mejores ganancias que le ayuden para los gastos de su hogar y poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Rosa has worked for several years in the breeding of chicken on her mini farm. She has a lot of experience in this activity that has provided her good income to cover the costs of her household. She lives with her husband and her son. Rosa wants to continue working but she does not have the supplies necessary. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy concentrate, vitamins, and more chickens to continue her work and obtain better earnings to pay the household costs and give her family economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase concentrate, vitamins, and more chickens

loans.name: Enkhzaya

texts.en:
Borrower Mrs. Enkhzaya is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in an outer ger district which lacks the basic infrastructure of the city. She works as a social manager at a local NGO. Her husband runs public transportation with a small minivan. 

Spring and summer are housing/construction work seasons, so Enkhzaya plans to perform some renovations on her current house. She really appreciates Kiva loans, thus she is requesting a 2,800,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials

loans.name: Clara Rosa

texts.es: Microempresaria exitosa es Clara mujer de 58 años de edad, soltera, tiene 23 años de tener su negocio en la venta de comida y bordados, tiene 1 año de ser cliente de  la institución , tiene tres hijos ya mayores de edad, quien uno de ellos le ayudan en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como 30 yardas de telas, 24 unidades de toallas tejidas, 30 unidades de sabana, 8 yardas de cintas, 8 yardas de borde, un rollo de lona, 12 unidades toallitas, una docena estampado etc.
texts.en: Clara is a successful small business owner.  She is 58 years old, single, and has had this business for 23 years.  She sells food and embroidery and has been a client of the institution for one year.  She has three adult children and one of them helps her with her business.  She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as 30 yards of fabric, 24 towels, 30 bed sheets, 8 yards of laces, 8 yards of embroidery thread, a roll of canvas, 12 small towels, one dozen patterns, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar is 53 years old. He lives in Marneuli District with his 29-year-old daughter. Eldar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family is out of sources of income at the moment. Eldar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Eldar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Eldar will purchase a car. He will drive the car as a taxi to serve local people and earn daily income. This will help him to cover the family expenses and improve their living conditions. Eldar awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a car and use it as a taxi

loans.name: Hilda Bonifacia

texts.es: Hilda, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hilda lleva dos años de haber establecido una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como productos enlatados, lácteos, productos de aseo, granos básicos etc. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo que es por 20,000 lempiras para poder surtir mas su pulpería con productos como granos básicos, azúcar, lácteos, churros, refrescos, manteca, condimentos, etc. Para la venta. Su objetivo es mantener en crecimiento el negocio y lograr que sus hijos se gradúen.
texts.en: Hilda is 33-years-old, is married, has 3 children, and lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. Hilda established a grocery store two years ago where she sells products of basic need such as canned products, dairy products, bathroom items, basic grains, etc. She has decided to request a second loan for 20,000 lempiras to supply the grocery store with products such as basic grains, sugar, dairy products, churros, refreshments, lard, spices, etc. to sell. Her objective is to grow her business and have her children graduate.

loans.use: to purchase products of daily consumption such as basic grains, sugar, dairy products. churros, refreshments, lard and condiments to supply her business

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz. Frijol, maicillo, entre otros y crianza de aves de corral. Ella vive actualmente con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 16 y 21 años de edad; el oficio lo aprendió con sus padres y lo realiza con su esposo y sus hijos.
El crédito que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas para la siembra de ocho tareas de tierra y también comprar un cerdo; este le ayudara para sacar un mejor rendimiento  en la cosecha, el riesgo que existe es una escases de lluvia que afecte la producción. 
Su sueño es trabajar mucho junto a su familia  para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa raises basic grains such as corn, beans, maicello, and other things.  She also raises poultry.  She lives with he husband and two children, ages 16 and 21.  She learned this trade from her parents and does it with her husband and children.  She needs this loan to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides so she can plant on eight plots of land. She also wants to buy a pig.  This will help her have a better harvest.  The risk is that there is a shortage of rain that affects production.

Her dream is to work a lot with her family so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon has been a fish farmer with her husband for several years. She owns a pond farm adjacent to her house, where she manages to breed fish to generate income. Suon enjoys working in this type of business because the fish will lead her to higher profits at the local market, allowing her to improve her business and improve her family’s living standards. 

She mentioned that the fish are resilient to adverse water conditions, fetch high prices, and show strong year-round demand from buyers. However, Suon still needs more techniques to save her pond, while the climate seriously changes and the water level reaches great heights. Suon would like to request a loan from Kiva lenders to help her keep running a sustainable business and having a good profit. She will use the loan to buy feeds to give enough nutrition to her fish. She thanks lenders who will help her and her family with the loan and give her the opportunity to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds to give enough nutrition to her fish.

loans.name: Abdulrab

texts.en:
Abdulrab is a single, 27-year-old young man who lives with his family (parents and relatives) in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a soldier getting a low salary and protects his home. For the past one year, he has been selling recharged mobile cards, which has been a profitable project and another source of income for him. 

He requested a youth loan of 100,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy recharged mobile cards for his business. He believes that he will be able to grow his business and increase his profits. He hopes to be able to get married and provide for all of his family's needs and improve their current financial condition.

loans.use: to buy recharged mobile cards for his business.

loans.name: Kushinga Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 57-year-old Tambudzai from Masvingo. Tambudzai is divorced with no children. Tambudzai runs a retail business which sells clothes and groceries. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenge being faced is of space, because she is currently occupying a small shop, and she wishes to occupy a bigger shop that can accommodate more stock. 

Tambudzai has requested a loan of $1,000 to buy more groceries and clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her an increase in disposable income and hence, improved family welfare. In the future, Tambudzai plans to build her own shop that can accommodate the volume of her trade.

loans.use: to buy clothes and groceries.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has a scrap metal business in Nakuru, which he has operated for the past four years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more stock of scrap metals for use in his business.

With the anticipated profit, he hopes to complete building the unfinished part of his rental houses. He hopes to have an easy life during his old age.

loans.use: To buy more scrap metal.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодире 22 года. Она замужем, но не имеет  детей. Ее муж  получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.    Нодира решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Ее свекровь и муж будут помогать ей введение бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить свою семью с хорошим условием проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  2500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nodira is 22 years old.  She is married, with no children.  Her husband's small income is not enough to provide the family with all the necessities of life.  Nodira has therefore decided to help her husband, for the sake of her family.  With this goal in mind, she has attended a course entitled "Achieving Success", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she has earned a certificate.  She is now fully ready to start her business and to be a successful entrepreneur in her chosen field.

Nodira wants to start her own business buying and selling livestock because she already has some experience in this area.  Her mother-in-law and her husband will be helping her to manage the business.  With the income that she will make, she plans to provide good living conditions for her family.

She is requesting a loan of 2,500 somoni to purchase some livestock, in order to start her new business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in a food-vending business and has been selling home-cooked foods to the people in her place for more than five years now. 

Teresita is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, meat, cooking oil, seasonings and other items. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her sales and income. In the future, Teresita dreams of making her food-vending business a success.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, meat, cooking oil, seasonings and other items.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel de 61 años de edad,  es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 5 hijos, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra maíz. Don miguel  desea incrementar sus ventas y por solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía que es donde siembra. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Miguel is 61-years-old. He is a responsible man with household obligations since he has always been characterized by providing the best for his family. Currently he lives with his life partner and his 5 children. He is a hard worker and has always worked with happiness and enthusiasm.  He works in agriculture harvesting corn. 

Miguel wants to increase his sales and for this reason is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase: seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and other items. Also he can improve his land where he harvests that is displayed in the picture. He would like to rely on the help requested because he does not have any other monetary income. This way he can assure that he will provide the daily bread to his home without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like Nomi, wheat flour, sugar, wool and many other things.

loans.name: Hannah Ngendo

texts.en:
Hannah is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy seeds and fertilizer during this planting season. She repaid her previous loan on time.

With anticipated profit, she hopes to pay school fees and expand her farming business. In the near future, she hopes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase farm seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 34 años de edad,  es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad. El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz; sus productos son de muy buena calidad la comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Juan solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan is 34-years-old, he is friendly and a hard worker, and he lives with his wife and two sons. They are 6 and 2 years old. He works very hard harvesting corn. His products are very good quality. He sells them to the different markets that are close to his house. 

Juan is requesting a loan to Integral to count on the money necessary to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as disease control, fertilizer, manure, seeds, and other items to harvest. He longs to increase his earnings so he can increase his earnings and give his family economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc

loans.name: Shaheen Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 45-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and four children. Her husband has been running a business of gemstones for 30 years. He is running a shop in the main market of the city. 

Shaheen, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the loan amount, her husband wants to purchase a new variety of rare gemstones. This would attract more customers, and his sales would be increased. After getting the profit, Shaheen would pay the installments of the loan and save some money for the marriages of her children. 

NOTE: In the picture, Shaheen is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase gemstones for selling.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария работает в центральном магазине в своем родном селе Нанково. Там она арендует точку, где торгует детскими товарами и питанием (смесями). Мария работает в этой сфере уже 2 года. Главное преимущество ее бизнеса – это отсутствие конкуренции в селе. Мария очень трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная. 
Мария обратилась к КИВА за дополнительной финансовой помощью в размере 10 000 гривен, чтобы пополнить товар на точке, а именно закупить памперсы, влажные салфетки, разные средства гигиены для малышей. Мария хочет постепенно расширять бизнес, чтобы обеспечивать себя и детей, так как с мужем у нее отношения напряженные и часто на данном этапе финансово помогает мама.
texts.en:
Mariya works at a central store in her native village Nankovo. There she rents a selling space, where she sells children's goods and food (mixtures). Mariya has worked in this area for two years already. The main advantage of this business is the lack of competitors in the village.

Mariya is very hardworking and cheerful. She turned to Kiva for financial support of the amount of 10,000 hryvnia, in order to restock products in her store, namely to purchase diapers, baby wipes and other hygiene products for babies. Mariya would like to develop her business step-wise, in order to support herself and her children. Her relations with her husband are strained, and currently her mother often supports her financially.

loans.use: to restock goods for her sales point, namely to purchase diapers, baby wipes and other hygiene products for babies

loans.name: Alimardon

texts.ru: Алимардон житель района Дж.Руми. Ему 47 лет. Он женат и является отцом троих детей. Алимардон работает трактористом. Одновременно он со своей семьей занимается растениеводством и животноводством. Дочь Алимардона раньше работала швеей. Она вышивала женские национальные платья, однако по стечению обстоятельств она прекратила свою деятельность. В данный момент Алимардон хочет помочь дочери заново начать свою деятельность. Он запрашивает кредит для приобретения швейной машинки и тканей для вышивания. В будущем за счет прибыли с деятельности дочери Алимардон хочет провести ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Alimardon is a resident of the region of J. Rumy. He is 47 years old, he is married and is a father of three children. Alimardon works as a tractor driver. At the same time he does plant cultivation and animal husbandry with his family. His daughter used to work as a seamstress. She embroidered women's traditional dresses, but because of circumstances she had to stop her business. At this time Alimardon wants to help his daughter start her business over. He is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and fabrics for embroidery. In the future he wants to use the profit from his daughter's business to make repairs in their home.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabrics for embroidery.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза жительница города Конибодом, расположенный на севере Таджикистана. Она 27-летняя замужняя женщина с тремя детьми. У нее одна дочь и двое сыновей. В данный момент ее муж находится на заработках в загранице. Дилноза очень трудолюбивая женщина. Вот уже 5 лет как она занимается и растениводством и животноводством. У нее имеется 0,03 га собственной земли и еще она арендует 2 га земли. Дилноза на этих участках земли выращивает овощи, в основном картофель и морковь. Одновременно Дилноза с помощью родителей занимается куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Кредит запрашивает для приобретения минерального удобрения с целью обработки земли, а также закупа 3-х голов бычков и их корма.
texts.en:
Dilnoza is a resident of the city of Konibodom, located in the north of Tajikistan. She is a 27 years old, married woman, with three children. She has one daughter and two sons. Currently, her husband is abroad as a migrant worker. 

Dilnoza is a very hard working woman. She has worked with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding for 5 years already. She has 0.03 hectares of own land and she also rents 2 hectares of land. Dilnoza grows vegetables on these plots, mainly potatoes and carrots. At the same time, Dilnoza works with buying and reselling cattle, with the help of her parents. 

She takes a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers with an aim to process the land, and further for the purchase of three bulls and fodder for them.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers to process the land, and further to purchase three bulls and fodder for them

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод женатый молодой человек. Ему 21 год. У него один маленький сын. Дилмурод с женой, сыном и матерью проживает в городе Конибодом, на севере страны. Его жена учится в Медицинском институте и в свободное время занимается вышиванием. Сам Дилмурод работает в автосервисе мастером по ремонту автомашин. Он занимается этим делом уже 4 года. Дилмурод чинит легковые машины и микроавтобусы Газель. Он имеет много клиентов, так как является опытным мастером. Дилмурод намерен расширить свою деятельность. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа необходимых инструментов по ремонту автомашин.
texts.en: Dilmurod is a married young man. He is 21 years old and he has a little son. Dilmurod with his wife, son and mother live in the town of Kinobodom on north side of the country. His wife is studying at the Medical Institute and does embroidery in her free time. Dilmurod works in the auto service as a car repairman. He has been in this business for four years. Dilmurod repairs passenger cars and minivans by the mark of Gazel. He has many customers as he is an experienced professional. Dilmurod plans to expand his business. He is asking for a loan to buy necessary tools to repair vehicles.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair vehicles.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасулу 43 года. У него жена и шестеро детей. Он со своей семьей проживает в районе Дж.Руми, на юге страны. Абдурасул занимается сельским хозяйством. Одновременно он хочет начать новый бизнес. Его интересует животноводство. Абдурасул намерен заняться куплей и продажей мелкорогатого скота. У него есть опыт в разведении скота. К тому же при дворе его дома имеется сарай для содержания скота, а скотный рынок находится недалеко от его дома. Чтобы начать новый бизнес, Абдурасул обратился за кредитом. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа 20-голов овец с целью дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. Прибыль с деятельности он планирует потратить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Abdurasul is 43 years old. He has a wife and six children. He lives in the J. Rumy region, in the south of the country, together with his family. 

Abdurasul works with agriculture. He also wants to start a new business. He is interested in livestock breeding. Abdurasul intends to work with buying and reselling sheep and goats. He has experience in this area. Besides, in the courtyard of his house, there is a barn for livestock, and the livestock market is not far from his home. 

In order to start the new business, Abdurasul applied for a loan. He requests a loan for the purchase of 20 sheep with an aim to further fatten and resell them. He plans to spend the income from the business to refurbish his house.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep with an aim to further fatten and resell them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Biimu

texts.en: Biimu is a hard working woman who strives hard to ensure her family is well. She is taking out a new Kiva loan of KES 30,000 to expand her existing business. With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle and repair it from the breakdown experienced for continuity of the business. She is grateful for Kiva lenders and Yehu microfinance for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su familia en casa propia, ella se dedica a vender zapatos de forma ambulante en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es de buena calidad y a precios muy accesibles con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como sandalias de diferentes estilos,  zapatos deportivos,  zapatos de vestir para damas y caballeros  para surtir su negocio y asi  seguir ayudando en los gastos de su hogar .
texts.en:
The borrower, who lives with her family in their own home, works as a street vendor selling shoes in different markets near her place of residence.  She has many customers because of the quality and low prices of her products.  With her earnings she is able to cover household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as different styles of sandals, sport shoes and women's and men's dress shoes.  This is so she can stock her business and continue helping with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy different styles of sandals, sport shoes and women's and men's dress shoes.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en: Rubilyn has a general store. She has been running her business for over four years. She usually earns a net income of PHP 300 a day. To further improve her business, Rubilyn is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, beverages and assorted bread to sell. She hopes that with this loan, her dreams for her business will come into reality. So, she is really hoping for loan approval.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, condiments, beverages and assorted bread to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items like sugar and rice for her general store

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: La señora Reyna Maria habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe en el barrio Buenos Aires junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, el la apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que trabaja como conductor para una empresa privada, ella es comerciante vende Ropa de segunda, en su casa y  por encargo, actualmente esta recibiendo buena demanda de parte los clientes por lo que con este credito comprara Paca de Ropa, por seleccion, para niños, adolecentes y adulto tambien quiere experimentar comprado una paca de zapatos usados a ver si le resulta y agrandar asi su negocio, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic  y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Reyna Maria lives in the town of Ticuantepe in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires with her common-law husband and children.  Her husband helps with the household expenses as he works as a driver for a private company.  Reyna Maria sells used clothing out of her home on an order basis.  Since the current demand from her customers is high she will use the loan to buy a selection of clothing for children, youth and adults.  She also wants to experiment buying a collection of used footwear to see how it goes in an effort to expand her business.

She is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en: Adelia is a 48-year-old married mother of nine children living in San Juan, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is planting and harvesting vegetables and bananas from her garden and earning 3,500 PHP for a living. This year, she has joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance and is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. She plans to cultivate the entire farm to double their income so they can send their children to school.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Doña rosa de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y su esposo, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de plantas naturales como:  margaritas, rosas, claveles, entre otros, desde hace 15 años, tiene mucha clientela pues vende variedad de plantas y a precios muy accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la  ayuda de su esposo y  de una de sus hijas logran cubrir algunos gastos del hogar,  doña rosa solicita un crédito para poder comprar mas variedad de plantas por mayor para seguir  obteniendo mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa, 55, lives in her own home with her two daughters and husband.  She has a small business selling natural plants such as daisies, roses, carnations, etc., and has been in business for 15 years.  Because of the variety of plants she sells and her low prices she has many customers.  With her earnings and help from her husband and one of her daughters she is able to cover the household expenses.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy a wider variety of plants wholesale to earn more profit and give her family more economic stability.

loans.use: To buy flowers and plants wholesale.

loans.name: Miguel De Los Santos

texts.es: El señor Miguel, hombre trabajador y humilde, desde muy joven se dedica a trabajar la tierra cultivando piña, su epsosa e hijos le apoyan en todas sus decisiones, su mayor sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida, actualmente cultiva dos manzanas de piña las cuales requieren de Mantenimiento para combatir las plagas, con este nu evo credito comprara los insumos y fertilizantes necesarios como: Urea, Completo, Triple etc. Asi su cosecha sera de buena calidad y sus ingresos aumentaran. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado
texts.en:
Miguel is a hard-working, humble man who has worked cultivating pineapple from a very young age.  His wife and children support him in his decision-making and his greatest goal is to improve their living conditions.  

He is now growing two acres of pineapple which require maintenance to fight off plant diseases.  He will use this new loan to buy supplies and the necessary fertilizers such as urea, "Completo", "Triple", etc.  This will enhance crop quality and increase his income.  

He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy supplies for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más. Ella es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. la clienta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias. la clienta es una mujer muy responsable quien desea mucho poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The borrower lives with her husband and three children.  She runs a store where she sells essential items such as bread, milk, eggs, canned goods, mineral water, vegetables and other products.  She is a very responsible, kind person who has many customers despite the fact that her store does not carry many products.

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy more products because her greatest goal is to have a larger store inventory so she can increase her earnings.  This responsible woman wants to give her family the best she can.

loans.use: To buy eggs, milk, flour, rice, beans, cream, etc.

loans.name: Al-Ekhlass Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ekhlass which consists of 4 ladies who live in Dhamar, Yemen. They work hard to improve their lives. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER.
Sabah is a 29-year-old, married woman and she is the leader of this group. Her family lives in small house. It is very difficult and uncomfortable for them.
She is requesting a 50,000 YER loan from AMB to help cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture and home appliances in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking out this loan will allow her and her family to have comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to help cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture and home appliances in order to improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity has operated a clothes selling business. She sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is a 38-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a barber shop for three years. Due to the increase in the number of customers, her husband wants to expand his business. For that purpose, Rabia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would use the loan to purchase some new chairs for his shop. He would also buy some items like a shaving machine, creams, a dryer, blades, etc. This would increase his earnings and net income. Rabia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs for her husband's barber shop

loans.name: Risolat

texts.en: Risolat is a 57 year-old woman, divorcee, and the mother of three children. She has a high degree. She has worked for more than 35 years in a school. She is a smart teacher. Now, she is a director of a school. She knows her business very well. Her colleagues know her as a smart, clever and kind woman. Now, she is going to build a building for a café at her house. She wants to organize her own business. There is a great demand for a café in her region. She hopes that her business will go very well. She is asking for a loan of 12,800 somoni to buy building materials. In this way, she will provide a high quality living condition for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to a build café.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Narantuya, 50 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has retired from work and gets a state pension. Her elder son currently stays at home and is unemployed and her younger son studies at the university. She has been selling various small sized items to local people since 2001 and accumulated a vast amount of experience in this business. Before this business, she had worked as doctor's assistant at a hospital for five years. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase goods from China. As a result, she can continue to run her business without worrying about an inventory shortage. Because her goods are small and fast circulating items, there is no worry she can't sell all these items. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory from China to sell

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah does a motorcycle transport business in Kangundo town. He has been in this business for the past five years and it has been profitable. Besides the motorcycle business, he is also a cash crop farmer. He is 27 years old, married, and has one child.

This is his second loan term; he plans to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle and keep it in good condition. He also wants to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. He will use the anticipated income to open a retail shop for his wife.

He hopes to buy another motorcycle and be able to make more income thereby improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts and also buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: Nigora is a perfect seamstress. She is a 27-year-old woman who is not married and has no children. Two years ago she began her own business of sewing national women dresses after she took the course “To Get Ahead” at a woman’s organization and got a loan from IMON. She works at the atelier. Thanks to the good services, she has managed to gain many customers. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to develop her business further but she needs to buy a new sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She promises to make her payments on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. He is married and has two children of whom one is still in school. He has practiced farming for over twenty years growing cash crops and rearing livestock. Besides farming, he has a retail business which brings in additional income.
He has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy goat. The major challenges he faces are animal and crop pests and diseases, and insufficient funds.
This loan will help him to generate more income and thus improve his family's living standards. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for the fast processing of loans.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy goat.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is married with four school going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for her childre.
For the past six years, she has operated a tailoring business, sewing clothes from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and she is intending to open a shop premises for the business.
With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase clothes materials, as well as zipperss and needles for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes materials, zippers and needles for her business.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is married with five children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother and sister). She has a restaurant and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, Irish and sweet potatoes, and pounded groundnuts. She works six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation of the bunches of green bananas, seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant and educate her children to the university level. She resides in a family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes, rice and pounded groundnuts.

loans.name: Rithilia

texts.en:
Rithilia operates a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. 

With Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase a motorcycle to diversify into the transport business. 

She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to diversify into the transport business.

loans.name: Iraramira Central Group

texts.en: Francis is a 56-year-old married man borrowing with Iraramira Central Group. He has 10 children of his own and two dependents, who he has been looking after, since their parents passed away. All of them are of school-going age. He works daily excluding Sunday in the produce business, primarily trading in coffee. He has borrowed to buy coffee from fellow farmers so that he can dry it and sell to the middlemen. He supplements his income with a small grocery shop he opened for his wife in 2009. They hope to one day have a considerable source of income to be able to supply the coffee factories directly instead of going through the middlemen, thus increasing their profit margins. His major challenge is having enough money to pay tuition for all his children; this has made him to work extra hard to ensure they all go to school. More so, he also has challenges transporting the coffee because he uses a bicycle. He hopes that in the future he will be able to afford a motorcycle to ease this.

loans.use: Buy coffee from fellow farmers so that he can dry it and sell to the middlemen.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 35-year-old married man; he is married to Emily and blessed with five children. He has been in this business for the last three years with the monthly income of KES 15,000. He is taking his third loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD; he plans to purchase potato seedlings and fertilizers.

With the anticipated profit from his expanded business, Jackson will buy more lands to expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to develop his business.

loans.use: to enlarge the business.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en: Blesilda is a 36-year-old mother of four, from Casambalangan, Sta. Ana, Cagayan. To assist her husband to earn income for their family she is engaged in a hog raising business. To provide the needed feeds, vitamins and medicine for her animals to be healthy, Blesilda opted to request a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 which can be used to purchase these items. She just hopes that her loan request will be granted.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and medicine.

loans.name: Mich

texts.en:
Mich is standing next to a cow trough in a stable of his animals at the side of his house. He is 62 years old and a hardworking man who manages and performs many tasks at home being a responsible father of five grown-up children. 

He lives with his family in a traditional house in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. Mich began his own business in rice husbandry, trying hard to earn money to provide a better life for his children. His wife has been working with him in this occupation for more than 30 years. 

Now, he has requested a loan in the amount of KHR 600,000, which he will use to buy and install a concrete ladder up to his house. He hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan, because it will be used to improve his family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy and install a concrete ladder up to his house.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman, and has children who still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.
Riziki has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her area.
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase 4 sacks of tomatoes, 3 sacks of potatoes, as well as other fruits and green vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase sacks 4 of tomatoes, 3 sacks of potatoes,  and other various fruits and green vegetables.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella resides in the Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has four children, one of whom is of school-going age. She has practiced farming for over 25 years, growing and selling cash crops in the local market.

She wants to venture into milk production and so she has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo for purchasing dairy goats. The challenges she is facing in the business are insufficient funds and poor markets. In the next five years, she wants to be the leading goat milk producer in Kenya.

Isabella says that the loan acquired will improve her family's living standards. She likes Juhudi's loans because they are quickly processed and have low interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: One By One Women Group

texts.en:
Mary is married and a retired teacher. She has four children of which only two initially went to school due to a lack of tuition for the remaining two. But since she started the piggery and acquiring loans, she has educated all her children.

She started up a piggery project after she had retired from teaching and she has run it for over six years now. She is a new client to Ugafode Microfinance and has borrowed a loan of 400,000 UGX. The purpose of the loan is to acquire more pigs and also to buy feed for them. 

The challenges she has in her piggery business is weather and also price fluctuation, whereby during the rainy seasons it becomes hard for her to clean the sty, which may in turn breed diseases leading to the death of the pigs. She also has a pricing challenge from time to time. 

Her dream is to enlarge her piggery in order to get more income from the pigs. She is a hard working and resilient woman

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is married and has two children of school age. They reside in the Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya.

He has practised farming for five years, growing sugar cane, potatoes and beans and selling them in the local market.

He has seen a need to venture into livestock farming and so has requested a loan of KES 10,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase pigs. The major challenges he experiences in farming are: pests and diseases, lack of fertilizers and seasons of drought.

In the next five years, he wants to be a major supplier of pig products of the farmer's choice and he also wants to rear more pigs.

This loan will help him invest more in pigs and thus get more income and so it will enable his children to further their education and increase their income.

Kenneth says that Juhudi Kilimpo loan interest rates are relatively low compared to others.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is married with two children and one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of her sister. She has a business selling used shoes and has been in doing this for 8 years, selling to all to categories of people but on a retail basis only. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is married and has four children; three of them are still in school. They reside in Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. He has practiced farming for the past fifteen years, growing tea, fruits, and vegetables and selling them locally. Besides farming, he is a mason.
He has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 50,000 for purchasing irrigation equipment to improve the supply of water from the main source to his farm. This will improve his level of production. The major challenges he faces in his farming are drought, pests and diseases.
In the next five years, he wants to venture into dairy farming. This loan will help him in uplifting his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Munyengeri's Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35-year-old Chari from Masvingo. She is married with two children, both attending school. Chari runs a retail business selling meat, groceries and clothes. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenge being faced is the high transport costs to ferry cattle to the abattoir for slaughtering. Chari has requested a loan of $1,000 to buy cattle for stocking her butchery and groceries to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to improve the welfare of her family. In the future, Chari plans to build her own house from the proceeds generated by the business.

loans.use: to buy cattle to butcher and sell and groceries to resell

loans.name: Ashjan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ashjan, which consists of six ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 250,000 YER.

Ashjan is a 21-year-old married woman who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is employed and gets a small salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs. She works hard to provide for her family. She needs to buy a fridge to keep foods and juices safe and cold.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new fridge in order to improve the living conditions in her house. 

Taking this loan will allow her and her family to feel comfortable, so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge in order to improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Originally from the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham, Kim owns and manages her cassava plantations in Rattanakiri province to generate an income to nourish her children. Of her nine children, five are single and four are married. She is a 57-year-old hardworking-honest woman, dedicating her lifetime to farming in order to help lift her family out of poverty and help her children with their education. She says that she enjoys what she does and believes she is doing well because of her practical experience.
She is now asking for a loan which she intends to use to buy land for farming cassava. This will enable to her to produce a good crop and be able to continue working toward her dream of improving her family’s standard of living and helping her younger children obtain a professional degree.

loans.use: to buy land for farming cassava.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is single and has two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and the high cost of transportation of her goods to her place of work.
For the past two years, she has operated a green grocery shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other people who own green groceries. Her dream is to establish a fruit parlor in the future.
With the loan that she is requesting she has wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. 
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Benkadi   est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leurs capacités financières afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits à l’image de Bassira. 
Bassira, qui est le membre du groupe papier en main, fait l’achat vente d’habits.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  10 pièces de pagnes de différents types avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of four married women, who are, on average, 39 years old and have four children. They live mostly in traditional families in the Torakabougou neighborhood in Bougouni. They all know each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. 

To increase their financial capacity in order to better conduct their businesses, the women joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second loan.

This group of women sells clothing just like Bassira. Bassira, who is the one with paper in her hand, buys and sells clothing. With this loan, she hopes to buy 10 lengths of pagne [brightly colored fabric] of different types from the wholesalers in Bamako.

Bassira makes her sales at a market and from home, for cash and credit, to customers who are men and women. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 42,000 francs CFA, which will be invested in [the group's] businesses and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is single with one child who attends school and is under her care. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For more than four years, Rose has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Rose wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with five children, all of whom are in school. She does not take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for five years. 

Monica has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through hiring out her motorcycle. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

Monica aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is 21 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has a three-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. 

She describes herself as a business-minded woman. For the past four years, she has been running a shop where she sells used clothes in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7AM to 6PM. 

She likes her business because she makes more profit and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She always uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business spot. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with four children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
She operates a food making business, making food like beans, dumplings, chapatti (flat bread) and sells to passersby and neighbors. With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en:
Sanobar is a hardworking woman. She has a great desire to be a successful and a perfect business lady. Her lifetime partner is a kind man, and they have 4 children. They live in the house her husband has succeeded in building thanks to his great dedication.
She is one of the hard working businesswomen in her town. For more than 12 years she has been busy with home products and clothes sales. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop the business and in this way improve their living conditions. She manages her business alone now. She wants to develop it further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy to buy more inventory for her store.
This is the 13th loan she is requesting from IMON and she feels deeply grateful for the economic support she has received to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her store.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area, which features the most populated market of Montserrado County. She is single and has two children, ages 8 and 19. Only one of her children is in school and two of them live at home. 

Cecelia describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past three years, she has run a market-table where she sells rice, oil and dry meat in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared taxi every time to transport her goods to her business spot.

Cecelia is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil and dry meat for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thank you to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil and dry meat for her business.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in Vanadzor, in the region of Lori, with his wife and two small daughters. For many years Artur has worked as an official driver, but for the last two years he has driven a taxi. He transports people mainly to Georgia and to the Russian Federation. These kind of far distances he must drive very carefully and attentively. That is why he has many loyal customers and they always pay him well. Artur’s car brand is Opel and he does his best to keep it clean and in a working condition. Artur is asking for a loan of 330.000 Armenian drams to do some repairs on his car and he also wants to buy tires. It will allow him to have a more comfortable and safe car.
He thanks Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon and he hopes that his first loan will be the beginning of a continuous cooperation.

loans.use: to repair his car and buy new tires for it.

loans.name: Santhiaba Mosquee Ps Group

texts.fr: LE BANC VILLAGEOIS QUI ABRITE CE GROUPE EST CREE LE 11 MAI 2001. CE GROUPE EST COMPOSE DE 7 MEMBRES QUI S'ACTIVENT DANS LE COMMERCE. ELLES ONT TOUJOURS REMBOURSE LEURS PRETS SANS DIFFICULTE ET A TEMPS. NDEYE TACKO QUI EST A LA DROITE DE LA PHOTO LEVANT LA MAIN ET LA REPRESENTANTE DU GROUPE. ELLE EST CELIBATAIRE SENS ENFANT ET AGEE DE 31 ANS. ELLE S ACTIVE DEPUIS PLUS DE 5 ANS DANS LA VENTE DE POISSONS SECHES DES PRODUITS COSMETIQUES ET VENTE DE JUS DE FRUITS. AVEC MON ESPERIENCE JE M EN SORT TRES BIEN MAIS PARFOIS C EST DIFFICILE QUE LES CLIENTS HONORENT A LEURS ENGAGEMENTS. LES BENEFICES SERVENT A RENFORCER MES EPARGNES A ME PRENDRE EN CHARGE ET A AIDER MES FRERES ET SOEURS A PAYER LA SCOLARITE ET LA NOURRITURE.
texts.en:
This group is part of a "banc villageois" loan association created May 11, 2001. It consists of 7 members active in retail trade .They have always refunded their loans on time and without difficulty.

Ndeye Tacko, who is raising her hand on the right of the photo, represents the group. She is 31 years old, single without children. For the past five years she has been actively selling dried fish, cosmetics and fruit juice.

She manages quite well given her experience, but sometimes it is difficult to see that customers honor their commitments.

The profits will be used to bolster her savings, to support herself, and help her brothers and sisters pay for tuition and food.

loans.use: buy dried fish and cosmetics

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is a married man with 2 children. He’s 37 years old and is really attached to his family.
Elshan started his business when he was 28. He had to work really hard to prove that he was able to support for his family. Elshan has been repairing cars in his own garage, and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services.
Elshan’s parents are old and sick people. His father has asthma.
He periodically spends money for his father’s treatments but now he needs to be treated at the hospital. Elshan says that he doesn’t receive enough income to support his father’s needs. Being very ill he has no hope for recovery. It is really demoralizing.
Today, he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner VFAC to pay hospital expenses for his father.

loans.use: to pay for hospital expenses for his elderly, ill father.

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en: Bintu is 39 years old and lives in West point, an area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is living together with her fiancée who is a carpenter. They both have two children who are 5 and 12 years old, and are in school and live at home. She described herself as a hardworking person, and for the past 7 years she has been running a shop where she sells plates, spoons, cook-spoons, cups, etc. in the local market. She likes her business because the customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her fiancée. She walks every day to buy her goods since her shop is close to the local wholesales area. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventories for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a single woman who has four children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and rental bills.
